note.p: From November 3 through 11, the entries in the diary appear to be written by another person. The handwriting is different, as are some of the spelling idiosyncrasies. The handwriting changes the day after Anna Mellinger wrote she was planning on taking a trip and the entries resume in her handwriting after she returns. It is possible she asked someone else in her household to keep a record while she was away.

div1.head: Biography
div1.p: Anna Mellinger was the young wife of a Franklin County farmer. She kept a diary throughout 1864 when Chambersburg was invaded and burned by Confederate troops. In it she very briefly describes the invasion and aftermath of the raid. Most of her diary, however, is concerned with the weather and the everyday activities in and around a Pennsylvanian farm. She refers often to family members, friends, and church activities. In November 1864 it appears that someone else wrote in her diary during Mellinger's absence from the farm.

div3.head: May th 9 1857
div3.p:
we left home for West
we took our horse and Carrage to Peter Mellingers the first day then we took the car for Macanicsburg we Staid all Night at Brother Landis on Satterday night Sunday we went to Christ Bucks Bookeat Dinner in the Evening from there went to David BucksBook Eat Supper on Sunday Evening went to to Brother Diedrichs Steiner

On Monday Morning th 12 Day of May we left Die'h for Mechanicsburgh we Stopt at Sisters Neweummers Eat Supper at Six OClock thirty minutes for Herrisburg Staid alnight we left the next morning at four OClock we eat breakfest in AltoniaAltona in the Evening we landed in WostartWooster Ohio at nine O Clock in the evening took lodging there

On the 13th Day of May we hired a hack to Smithvile
Wayne Co. took Dinner at Friend Brenners in the afternoon Brenner took us to Brother Stootsmans
On the 14 there was Evening Meeting at Brother Stootsman

on the 15 they took us to Wooster from there to MansfieltMansfield from there to Lexington from ther to Brother Bars from there to Brother Ernst Minister from there to Brother Knowers
Morro County
Mount Gilliad seat of the Co. of Ohio

div3.head: May th 17 Sunday
div3.p: there was Meeting in the Meeting house after meeting we went to Brother Hilts from there to Brother Strawbridges from there Sister Elys from there to Brother Lantzs from there to Brother Bairs Mansfield

div3.head: May 19th
div3.p: we left Bare, they took us to Brother Stoner near Spring Mansfield thers was Evening Meeting from there we went to Mansfield Richland Co. Ohio from there to Osborn Green County from there to Brother Kaufmans in Clark Co. Ohio then to Bro Clines then to Bro Wylands then to Bro Openlanders then to B Broseys then toBro Rohrar then to Bro John Harnish Minister then to a Sister from there to Bro Abraham Harnish then to Bro Shafers then back to Openlanders again we were all night there
24th was Meeting in the Meeting house at Midway

div3.head: May 25th
div3.p:
we left the Members in that Naighbourhood for Porter Co. State of Indiana then they took us Osborn and took the Cars to Dayton to Leffeette then to Westville from there to Bro Longs
Porter Co
then to Bro Burss then to Bro Millers from there to Preaching in School house from meeting to Bro Summers in the afternoon was an Examination at Bro Fairmans
on the 28 was Preaching at Bro Summers in the afternoon we left our members in that part
On the 29 Day of May we left our Members for Illinois

on the 30 Day of May we left Porter Co. for Illinois Henry Citty for John Stoner
Deep River

div3.head: June th 1st
div3.p: we left Henry Citty or Brother Johns family we left Henry at noon we left for Lescell then to Dixson from Dixson to Sterling landed at Abraham Landis Ill Whitesite Co.

div3.head: June 3d
div3.p: We left Landis for Emanuel Landis Widow she had Sale she had Sale that Day then we went to Bro Weavers all night

div3.head: 4th
div3.p: to Sister Monia Landis from thers we went to Evening Preaching from there back to Weavers again

div3.head: June 5th
div3.p:
we left Weavers went to
Bro Hendricks at Elk Crick then to the Widow Susan Landis then to Bro Delps then to Old Sister Hendricks in Sterling there was Preaching
On Satturday the 6 in the Evening we went to Ann Landis the Widow
On Sunday the 7 was Preacher at Brother Shultz in the Evening we went to Sterling again to Sister Hendricks over night
On Monday Morning the 8th we went to Bro Hages at nine o clock AM we left the members in that place for New York State
On the 9th Day of June at 4 oclock PM about 9 oclock in the Evening we arrived in Bufolo then we hired a hack that took us to Brother Riests we landed there at nine oclock that Evening

on the 11th Brother Riest took us to Buffalo we took the ferry boat across the River to Canada we went to Bro Augensteins first then to Jessa Morningstas then to Old Morningstars there was Evening Meeting in a school house we went to Jesse Morningstars and staid all night

Next day Satturday
he took us to the Black Crick there the Examination was on Sunday the Breaking of Bread was in there Meeling house on Satturday we went home with Bro & Sister Bardon
next day Sunday after meeting we went home with Bro Beems
in the morning on Monday Bro Beam took us to the ferry then left for New York State

div3.head: June th 15
div3.p:
that Evening was Preaching in the Williamsville meeting house
on the 15 at two oclock PM was meeting Bro Miller fetched us from the ferry we eat Dinner there he took us to the meeting after meeting went home with Bro Longs this was on the 15 on th to we u in the Evening after Supper we went we to Preaching and after Preaching we went home with old Sister Miller
on the 16th in the Morning Bro Knous took us to Reasers then they took us to Lancaster New York State we eat dinner at Reasers & Supper at Knous

On the 16 in the Evening at Six Oclock we left the Members in that place for good old Penn on the 18 we arived at Peter Mellinger & on the 19 we come to our Respective home sweet home
Anna Mellinger

div2.head: January 1864
div2.p: O Lord preserve us in thy ways that we turn not to the right nor left keep us beneath thy cross bestow us A willing heart and mind while all things Cometh from the keep us In thy narrow path and in thy Love and union with all thy Children and peace with all men
I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills from whence cometh my help My help cometh from the Lord which made heaven and earth
He will not Suffer thy foot to be moved he that keepeth the will not slumber Behold he that keepeth Israel shal neither Slumber nor Sleep

The Lord is thy keeper
the Lord is thy shade upon thy right hands
the sun shalll not smith the by day nor the moon by night
The Lord shall preserve the from all evel he shall preserve thy soul
The Lord shall shall presarve thy thy going out and thy coming in from this time forth and even for evermore

div3.head: January the first 1864
div3.p:
Friday New years Day
it was very cold. Isaac Stoner was here in the after noon him and Uncle went to the Poorhouse and to Abner Millers

div3.head: Satterday the 2 d
div3.p:
on Satterday Morning Isaac went home it was Still very cold yet Uncle cleaned the Stables and in the after noon he went to the Mill and brought the Paper
Polly was up geting Some Apple Butter we Baked and Churned Houptmans fetched the kettel

div3.head: Sunday the 3 rd
div3.p: Sunday Morning Bro Samuel Stoner and wife and yongest Son Paid us a visit and Bro John Houptman and Family were here too: all Eat diner here we all went Down to Pollys

div3.head: Monday th 4
div3.p: we washed and it Snowed it was not quite So cold Uncle was at the black Smith shops Harriet was up and at I mmels

div3.head: Tuesday the 5 th
div3.p: was Shelling Corn to Day Ben Fickes helpt to Shell Polly was up and Winecup they Eat Dinner with us it Snowed Some but more moderate

div3.head: Wednesday the 6 th
div3.p: this forenoon Uncle and the Girls cleaned up the Corn this Afternoon Uncle and Rebecca and I went to Town Anna Staid with Polly till we come back Polly come up to fetch Some things that we brought from Town for her it is calln and cold to Day John Houptman brought our Kettle and sausage stoffer home

div3.head: Thursday the 7 th
div3.p: this morning it was very Cold this Evening it is Snowing they were making Ready to thrash Ben Fickes Wheat Uncle had been up at Houptmans to fetch Ann Shoers Rebec patched uncles old coat and Ann & I was kniting

div3.head: Friday 8 th
div3.p:
Cold
Ben thrashed his wheat here on our mechene uncle drove the horsees we wor bakeing mince pies & jinger cakes Sister Liza Bury was to See us I went with her to Mag & Polly Herriet was up to we churned

div3.head: Saturday the 9 th
div3.p: to Day is very cold not thawing any Uncle cleaned the Stables we baked Bread & browned Coffee. I finished uncles "west" Ann was Sowing & Bec was kniting Ben Fickes was up Rachel Fickes come this Evening to Stay all night Jacob Lidig was here

div3.head: Sunday 10 th
div3.p:
Cold
we wor in Meeting to day Bro Jacob Frantz preached the Sermon Bro Jacob Lehmon preached first Rebeca & Rachel Fickes went to Lorance this after noon uncle went in to Flockmans this Evening Bro Jacob Frantz come home with him to Stay all night David Stoner Mary & Sarah was out to See us this Evening with the Slaigh

div3.head: Monday 11 th
div3.p: this mornig Uncle and Jacob Frantz Minister was up at Houptmans from there them & I went to Jacob Lidigs eat Dinner then I staid there Uncl & Jacob went Old Sister Luedig then he come back & we went home Our Butter Merchant was was here Ben claend his Wheat Cold Little more mild

div3.head: Tuesday the 12 th
div3.p: to Day it was not quite so cold it was thawing A little Uncle and I was up at Mattys help to clean Skins Cerpnan: come for his Butter

div3.head: Wednesday 13 th
div3.p: more modeate to Day we were up at Mattys help to make Sausages Relec was at home by herself Ann was in School

div3.head: Thursday 14 th
div3.p: very moderate to Day we butcherd to day one hog and a little beef Ben Fickes helpt us

div3.head: Friday the 15 th
div3.p: thawing to day soft we Serubed and made white pudings baked Bread & pyes uncle & Ben hauld Corn fodder

div3.head: Satterday 16 th
div3.p: to Day uncle was in Town Matty & Mary Stoner was here Polly was up Bens brought them Pork to Smoke Weather not very Cold I was at Bens & Pollys John I Stouffer fetch flour

div3.head: Sunday 17 th
div3.p: to Day David Butlers was here we went along to Polly Ben Fickes was up it was thawing very mutch

div3.head: Monday 18 th
div3.p: it is moderate to Day Brother John McCalib come from Clinton Conty This Evining he come to See us Staid all night with us we lived Neighbours in Stoughtown

div3.head: Tuesday 19 th
div3.p: Brother McCalib & us went up to Houptmans in the after noon we went to Bens & Pollys it is blowing up Cold this Evening Rebeca was at home by herSelf Brother staying all night with us

div3.head: Wednesday 02 et
div3.p:
Uncle & Bro McCalib went in to Bro Samls to Day Becca went up to Mattys Mary Stoner wennt with her I was at home by my Self Polly come up eat Dinner with me
I baked cakes

div3.head: Thursday 21 st
div3.p: To Day it Snowed a little we had been in Town Bel Stouffer come home with Ann from School I got a new dress

div3.head: Friday 22 d
div3.p: Uncle cleaned the Stables we washed we have been in Preaching this Evening Bro Saml & Jacob Lehman Preached

div3.head: Satturday 23 rd
div3.p: Uncle went to Stouffers town: we baked & Churnd and Ironed Herriet was up

div3.head: Sunday 24 th
div3.p: we went down to the pike to Preaching Bro Saml S Preached his test was in II Thessalonians Chapter V 21 & 22 verses very worm Mary Stoner was out here Brother Wagner come to stay all night

div3.head: Monday the 25 th
div3.p: Polly Liza & I went on a viset to Bro John Metzs weather is very ageeable worm for this time of the year

div3.head: Tuesday 26 th
div3.p: To day it is very plesent A Speing Day old Papy Lantz was here over Dinner & Mary Ouercash eat Dinner here to Edward Weston Come home this Evening from Carbon Co he eat Supper here

div3.head: Wednesday the 27
div3.p: Uncle was in town and looked after a hireling Ben was up this Evening

div3.head: Thuesday 28 th
div3.p: To day Maria Stouffer and Polly Eby was here to day they eat Dinner here and Herriet was up over Dinner Uncle was hauling Wood from Sheplers I went along down to See Mag & the Baby they are doing fine

div3.head: Friday 29 th
div3.p: To Day Daily Fickes & Herriet was here eat Supper Uncle cleaned the Stables the wether is disagreable warm for this time a year I was to see Mag

div3.head: Satturday 30 eth
div3.p: we went to Town to day we baked and churnd and brownd Coffee it is raining this evening a little Colder Herriet was up

div3.head: Sunday 31 st
div3.p: To day it was clouy and fogy Abe Hockman was out to See us Ben Fickes was up Bec was at Christ Stouffers Polly was up

div3.head:
February the first 1864
Monday the 1 st
div3.p: it Rained Some to Day I was down to See Mag and Polly uncle was at Bens yong Wingerd was here to hire

div3.head: Tuesday 2 nd
div3.p: Uncle took me down to mamy Lidig this after noon I spend the night with her it Snowd John Fickes fetch our Cown Sheller the weather is not very Cold the air is a little Colder than what it had been

div3.head: Wednesday 3 rd
div3.p: this morning Mamnia & I went to old John Metzs in the after noon we went to Obanans n in the Evening Uncle Came for me it was thawing a little Edward Weston eat Supper t with us

div3.head: Thursday 4 th
div3.p: To Day it is a little Colder weather is changeable I was down to See Polly & Mag nothing much going on uncle was at the Spring

div3.head: Friday 5 th
div3.p: to Day it is moderate we bought three Apples trees one Grape vine one Dozent of blackbery Stolks from Hofman a nursary man I was at Houptmans & at Mags & Pollys uncle cleand the Stables Ben was up

div3.head: Satteurday 6 th
div3.p: To Day the weather is favourable last night it rained a llittle we baked Uncle had been at Smoke Town after a hauling viz Isaac Winger Polly was up to day

div3.head: Sunday the 7
div3.p: To day was very pleusent we all had been in Preaching to day Abener Millers and Bec Lawrence came a long with us farom Meeting John Houptmans was down David Burk & Adrew Fickes & John Lawrance & Edward Weston were here Ann Mellinger

div3.head: Monday th 8
div3.p: To day it was more cold Polly and I have been in at Brother Samls the Butter Marchant & his man was was here all night Anna and Bec was down at Bens

div3.head: Tuesday the 9
div3.p: To day Uncle and I was in at Hockmans I and Betzy was to see Ryers and Martins Anna was at Joe Ryders to See Mary Cosgrove To day it more Cold it is freezeing

div3.head: Wednesday 10 th
div3.p: To day it is very Cold north wind blowing we was in Town Polly was a long

div3.head: Thursday 11 th
div3.p: To day Cold this Evening little more moderate Uncle was in at the Spring and at the Blaksmith Shop

div3.head: Friday 12 th
div3.p: Very agreable weather to day Hockman was out for Molasas uncle was Cleaning the Stables Herriet was up

div3.head: Satterday 13 th
div3.p: Still plesent and warm to day we hung our pork up to Smoke Ben brought there pork up to Smoke we baked Sponge cakes and ginger pies Becca went to John Fickes to Stay all night

div3.head: Sunday 14 th
div3.p: it was very Stormy but not very Cold Mary Burk was here Eat Dinner

div3.head: holder Monday 15 th
div3.p: more Cold to day and Cloudy Ryer and Wife was here to day on a visit Eat Supper with us Uncle was in Town to Day we baked

div3.head: Tuesday 16 th
div3.p: this Evening it is very Cold and windy to day it Snowed a little Uncle was at the Mill for brand for the Cows I was at Bens

div3.head: Wednesday 17 th
div3.p: it is very Cold and high winds froze very hard not much going on too Cold

div3.head: Thursday 18 th
div3.p: a little change not quite So Cold we had been up at Marthas to Day the Girls was at home by them Selves

div3.head: Friday the 19 th
div3.p: the weather is not much chaneged it is not quite So Cold. the Girls went to Town to Adam Snyders uncle was at Stricklers took the Income Tax Over John Metz was here for Molasas

div3.head: Saturday 20 th
div3.p: the weather is more moderate to Day Brother Jackson come to See us this Evening he is going to Stay all night

div3.head: Sunday 21 ist
div3.p: to day the weather is very pleasent Uncle & Jackson went to Meeting Rebeca was at Butlers Bro Abraham ?Bere Bair Come with uncle from meeting he is going to Stay all night

div3.head: Monday 22 d
div3.p: the weather plesent little Cloudy we washed this fore noon Uncle took Bair to Houptmans in the afternoon we took Bair to Christ Stouffers Jane Snyder was here

div3.head: Tuesday 23 rd
div3.p: to day the weather is very agreable Spring like I have the Head ache Uncle was in at the Spring we baked

div3.head: Wednesday 24 th
div3.p: weather is Still plesent Uncle & David Stoner went up to Isaac Bares for posts Carfman was out for Butter

div3.head: Thursday the 25 th
div3.p: weather very plesent to Day Uncle & Ben hauld Corn Fodder

div3.head: Friday 26 th
div3.p: To day the weather is more Cold and Stormy John Fickes Sale was to Day Uncle and the Girls was down Henry Funks come here to Stay all night

div3.head: Saturday the 27 th
div3.p: The weather is more calm to day Polly & I was in Town & at Butlers to Day Uncle was in at the Spring & at McKinseys Sales Ben was up this Euey

div3.head: Sunday the 28 th
div3.p: The weather is very calm but cloudy John Snyder & wife & three Daughters was here Over Dinner Hockmans & wife Bec Burk Edward Weston Ann Fickes all for Dinner: John Houptman & wife & Susan came in the afternoon

div3.head: Monday the 29 th
div3.p: the weather is plesent To day Uncle Commened ploughing but it was froze yets he had to quit he helpt Ben to Shell Corn we worked at the Grapes we took our Cabbage out of the ground

div3.head: Tuesday March the 1 st 1864
div3.p: this morning it Snowed and it is Snoing yet it is melting Some it aint very deep Uncle & Hockman was at Keaffers Sale Ben was up this Evening

div3.head: Wednesday 2 nd
div3.p: To day the Snow is melting it is going very fast Uncle helpt Ben to Shell Corn

div3.head: Thursday 3 d
div3.p: Thawing to day Uncle was Sowing Clover Seed he took 10 Bushels of wheat to the mill Polly was up

div3.head: Friday 4 th
div3.p: the weather is favourable To day our Bother Diedrich Stoner come to See us Brother Saml come with him

div3.head: Satterday 5 th
div3.p: Uncle and I took Dieder down to Abner Millers from there we went To Town it Rained to day then Uncle and Dieder went to Mattys after we come back from Town to Stay all night

div3.head: Sunday 6 th
div3.p:
we all went to Meeting Martin Hoover preached the interduction and Dieder preached the Sermon Ben KRiler was here from Meeting and Cate Mallon Over Dinner the weather is plesent little mudy
A Mellinger

div3.head: Monday 7 th
div3.p: the weather is Still plesent Ann and I dount feel So well it is cold and took Uncle comnenced ploughing to To day he was in Town this fore noon Dolly Burks was here

div3.head: Tuesday 8 th
div3.p: To day the the weather is plesent but mudy it is not Cold it is drying off

div3.head: Wednesday 9 th
div3.p: Rebeca was in Town To day the weather is Changeable

div3.head: Thursday 10 th
div3.p: this morning about 10 O Clock it Commenced Raining and is Raining yet this Evening, we needed a Rain, our Cisterns was dry the one at the Barn

div3.head: Friday 11 th
div3.p: the weather is very Changable it was Raining most all day Uncle was in Town

div3.head: Satturday 12 th
div3.p:
Uncle & I & Jacob Lehmon & Mary Stoner went to John Hoffmans we had Frank Lantz here with the girls we eat dinner with Catty Snively ?
on Satturday

div3.head: Sunday 13 th
div3.p: we went too Meeting from Hof this Evening we come home

div3.head: Monday 14 th
div3.p: Rebeca & I was in Town Bec got a new dress plesent weather

div3.head: Tuesday the 158 th
div3.p: the weather is pretty cold Uncle was ploughing to day

div3.head: Wednesday 16 th
div3.p: the weather is Changeable froze to hard to plough Uncle took a calf up to Mattys he brought brand from the mill

div3.head: Thursday 17 th
div3.p: Cant plough yet froze hard not quite So cold Liza Burk & Rachel Fickes was here to Day Eat Supper Billy Weston come home to Day

div3.head: Friday 18 th
div3.p: Uncle was ploughing to day the weather is petty fair will Weston was up and Polly was up for milk

div3.head: Saturday 19 th
div3.p: The ground is froze this morning this fore noon Uncle Cleaned the Stables and this after noon he was ploughing & he went to the mill & Brought the corn meal Rebecca took butter to town Polly & harriet was up

div3.head:
Friday 20 th
Sunday 20 th
div3.p: Cold & windy Cate Nellin Come to go to Meeting her & Rebeca & I went down to the pike to Meeting uncle Staid at home Ann & Mol burk went to Boobys Jacob Lehman and Saml Stoner Preached Edward Weston & Ben Fickes was up

div3.head: Monday 21 st
div3.p: the weather is Still Cold not much change Bill Weston & his wife & Polly was up

div3.head: Tuesday 22 nd
div3.p: this morning Uncle went down to Joe Ryders and to Bakers Sale Cold and Rough

div3.head: Wednesday 23 rd
div3.p: little more moderate we washed to day Uncle was at the mill fetched brand

div3.head: Thursday 24 th
div3.p: more plesent to day Mag McDowl moved Uncle took her over in the Carrage to day Isaac Wingard come to set in Rebec was along with Mag Ann Burk was here all night She come with Bec from Mags Fliten

div3.head: Fryday 25 th
div3.p: to day about noon it Commenced Snowing and Snowed till in the night Some time more Snow fell then any time this winter melting all the time Rebeca went to Lawrancs this Evening

div3.head: Satturday 26 th
div3.p: to day the Snow went very fast it Rained Some Jacob Lehmon was here
When Shall I See my Fathers face and in his bosam Rest When Shal I Reach that happy place And be for eve blest A Mellinger

div3.head: Easter Sunday 27 th
div3.p: to day it is plesent us and Jacob Lehmon and Martha ? was over at Jacob Lehmons on a Viset

div3.head: Monday 28 th
div3.p: this morning Uncle & I had been at John Fickes they are making ready to move. Andrew is Sick. Uncle was at the Mill fetched brand for the Cows

div3.head: Tuesday 29 th
div3.p: this evening it is Raining and blowing quite unplesent we was at John Fickes to day

div3.head: Wednesday 30 th
div3.p: last night it Commenced Snowing till to day about three O Clock this afternoon the Snow is very deep more Snow then we had this winter Uncle was at J Fickes this morning they want to move to day & the Snow Stopt them from moveing to day

div3.head: the first of April Thursday 31 th
div3.p: To day it is very Slushy the Snow is going fast we was over at John Mellingers they moved yesterday through the Snow John Fickes moved to day

div3.head: Fryday the first of April
div3.p:
Uncle was at the Spring fishing he catched Some fish the one waight one and a half lb two oz he got four in number they waight four lbs one oz most he ever catchd at one time
A. Mellinger S. Mellinger

div3.head: Satturday the nd 2 d
div3.p: To day it Snowd it was melting as fast as it come down very mudy not much going on now

div3.head: Sunday th 3 rd
div3.p: Uncle and I was down in Meeting in the Meeting house Jacob Lehmon preached the Sermon Saml Steiner the interduction after dinner we went to Saml and Ryers She is Sick

div3.head: Monday the 4 th
div3.p: To day John Mellinger and his Wife was here to See us this Evening it is Snowing again

div3.head: Tuesday the 5 th
div3.p: it was Snowing till noon Bro Saml Stoner was here

div3.head: Wednesday 6 th
div3.p: Liza Burk & I & Ann was to see Mag Uncle was in Town

div3.head: Thursday 7 th
div3.p: I was down at Browns Uncle was at Eversoles after planks he went to Town Billy Weston & his Wife was here eat Supper here Helen Henderson was here

div3.head: Fryday 8 th
div3.p: it was very plesent we made garden for the first this year Uncle took A log to Town for plank to fix the hog pen Daily and Andrew Fickes was here eat Dinner with us they had to Stay back Andy was Sick they want to go home as Soon as they can

div3.head: Satturday 9 th
div3.p: To day it rained all day and is Raining yet Ann was keeping the Children for Herriet they had been in Town

div3.head: Sunday 10 th
div3.p: This afternoon it was plesent this morning it was Raining Father Lantz & Bro Hockman was here eat Dinner Rebeca was at Houptmans we was all down to See Billy Weston he is going to leive us to morrow morning for his Camp Poor fellow

div3.head: Monday th 11
div3.p: to day it is is plesent we are making soap & Baked bread and pies Billy Weston Started to day for his Company

div3.head: Tuesday the 12
div3.p: to day we washed & finished our Soap Uncle was itn Town he brought Bec Westons Buerow out. it is Raining this Evening much Rain Isaac Shetters eat Dinner here

div3.head: Wednesday the 13
div3.p:
To day it was Showery Isaac and I planting Peach trees. the Girls was Ironing. Uncle was in Town and in at the Spring fishing A. Mellinger
old Winecup last night was here

div3.head: Thursday the 14 th
div3.p: To day very chanchable it Rained Some Uncle was down at Henry Ryders he took John down and brought another horse his name is Tom we Cleaned two Rooms up Stairs & Scoured crock lids

div3.head: Fryday the 15 th
div3.p: we was makeing garden to day it Rained a little Kurpman was out for for Butter old Winecup was here eat dinner

div3.head: Satturday 16 th
div3.p: To day it Rained all day we baked bread & pyes Uncle went a fishing Bec & Isaac went over to John Mellingers

div3.head: Sunday 17 th
div3.p: Uncle was down at the pike School house in Meeting Ann & I was in at Saml it Rain to day

div3.head: Monday 18 th
div3.p: our men was sowing oats the girls was fixing their flour beds: plesend weather to day no Rain to day Polly & Herriet was up

div3.head: Tuesday 19 th
div3.p:
To day its Rough and cold we had been up at Mattys we planted Some Potatos the Butter Merchant was here to day
A. Mellinger

div3.head: Wednesday 20 th
div3.p: To day it is plesent but Cloudy it Rained a little we planted Potatos the men is ploughing for corn

div3.head: Thuersday 21 th
div3.p: To day it is plesent it Rained a little its Still cold for this time of the year Uncle was up at Mattys help to plant little pair trees

div3.head: Fryday 22 nd
div3.p: Weather Changeable it was plesent to day: it is Raining this Evening I made a mistake Uncle was up at Mattys to day planting trees

div3.head: Satturday 23 rd
div3.p: To day was very plesent the warmest day this this Spring Polly & i was at Jo Metzes Brother

div3.head: Sunday 24 th
div3.p: To day is wery warm and plesent it is Raining a little this Evening groing weather Anna Stoner & Alace was here Edward Weston & Bec Weston all eat dinner here Mellinger and I was in at Saml Stoners

div3.head: Monday 25 th
div3.p: to day was plesent it Rained a little this Evening it Herriet: Susan & David Watson was up S & Da was here all night

div3.head: Tuesday 26 th
div3.p: To day John Stoner was here to day eat Diner here no Rain to day the men is busy ploughing

div3.head: Wednesday 27 th
div3.p: To day it was very windy Ann and I was in Town we went to See Joseph Eckerts

div3.head: Thursday 28 th
div3.p: To day we was washing and planting Potatos & early Corn: it is Cold this Evening the men is making Ready to plant Corn Uncle is ploughing for Hockman to day

div3.head: Fryday 29 th
div3.p: not quite as cold as it was Uncle is ploughing for Bens Ann was Ironing Bec was sewing churning

div3.head: Satturday 30 th
div3.p: To day we baked. Bec was in Town it is Raining this Evening

div3.head: Sunday the first Day of May
div3.p: we was all in Meetint it is plesent Saml Stoner & Jacob Lehmon Preached John Wingard come from meeting eat dinner

div3.head: Monday the 2 nd
div3.p:
To day it was raining it is Cool the men is ploughing for Hockman they ploughd Pollys lot it is to plant Sugar cane in
ich will iewen und liewen

div3.head: Tuesday 3 d
div3.p: it is cold it Rained a little to day we made a little garden the men is ploughg Polly was up for Corn

div3.head: Wednesday 4 th
div3.p: it is plesent to day no Rain we was diging garden the men plantet Pollys lot with Sorgom Seed Liza Burk & Mrs. Brown was here eat Supper

div3.head: Thursday 5 th
div3.p: To day we commenced planting Corn it is warm groing weather we churnd

div3.head: Friday 6 th
div3.p: To day we finished plantting Corn it is very plesent and warm we baked bread & pyes Mary Stoner was here

div3.head: Satturday 7 th
div3.p: To day we planted our lane Cane Seed it is very warm and plesent Uncle & I was in Town Mag McDowl was here to day we got a pack of coffee

div3.head: Sunday 8 th
div3.p: To day it is plesent Beca Anna and Isaac was up in Dunkurt Meeting Uncle was in at Ryers I was up at Houptmans Ben Fickes & Miller and Herriet was up

div3.head: Monday 9 th
div3.p: Polly & I was down at the pike on a Viset Uncle Come for us in the evening it Rained

div3.head: Tuesday 10 th
div3.p: Uncle was in Town for lath & lime to fix the wash house it Rained

div3.head: Wednesday 11 th
div3.p: the girls was washing Uncle was lathing the wash house it was Raining

div3.head: Thursday 12 th
div3.p: uncle catcht 4 fish waigh 4 lb 1/2 To day we was baking bread & pies it was Raining the men is working at the wash house

div3.head: Friday 13 th
div3.p: To day it Rained Ben Fickes plasterd our wash house

div3.head: Satturday 14 th
div3.p: we was in Town it Rained Martin Hershey & his wifer and Precila Hershey was here all night

div3.head: Whit Sunday 15 th
div3.p: To day it Rained and Thunderd all day very Showry we was in Meeting down in Stouffers Town School house Jacob Lehmon preached it is Raining yet

div3.head: Monday 16 th
div3.p: To day it rained. not much going on So very wet

div3.head: Tuesday 17 th
div3.p: it Rained Some to day the men was Shelling Corn Cousen John Stoner ? and his wife was here all night

div3.head: Wednesday 18 th
div3.p: it rained more to day we was white washing

div3.head: Thursday 19 th
div3.p: no rain to day we baked and Churned & browned Coffee Isaac plasterd corn Uncle worked at A Shuffel Plough

div3.head: Friday 20 th
div3.p: To day Releca & I was in Town, we baked bread & Pies

div3.head: Satturday 21 st
div3.p: To day Mary Wonderly my Niece & Sarah Wonderly come to See u s. Uncle fetched them from Town they come on the Cars

div3.head: Sunday 22 nd
div3.p: Rebeca is Sick Uncle fetched Dr Senenge out to See her Edward & Bek was up Houptman & Ben Joe Miller was up it Rained a few chops

div3.head: Monday 23 rd
div3.p: To day it was plesent Dr Sensney was out to See Beca She is better Mary & Sarah Wonderly went in to Bro Saml to day Jane Snyder was out

div3.head: Tuesday 24
div3.p: this Evening it rained and thundered till a 11 oclock the men was plowing Corn Becca is better again I have to hunt the bugs of the Cucumbers

div3.head: Wednesday 25 th
div3.p: to day it is plesent and worm it is Thundering this Evening I think it will Rain the night Polly was up & Herriet Uncle & Isaac took a Cow away that we Sold to Overcahs for 45 D

div3.head: Thursday 26 th
div3.p: last night it Commenced Raining and is Raining yet it is a settled rain warm

p.orig: To day Mary & Sarah Wonderly come here again it Rained

div3.head: Satturday 28 th
div3.p: Uncle took Mary & Sarah in Town to go home we had the Communion Examanation to day plesent Martin Hoover & Susan Bown come home with us

div3.head: Sunday 29 th
div3.p: to day the Communion or the breaking of Bread was Jacob Lehmons come home with us & Bingly from Meeting this Evening Ann & Liza Spangler & Savilla Harris come to Stay all night

div3.head: Monday 30 th
div3.p: I took them Sisters down to Henry Ryders and Daniel Stouffers I spend the day with them I eat dinner at Ryders & Supper at Dans

div3.head: Tuesday 31 st
div3.p: To day Matty & Mary Stoner brought Mary Polly here Spend the after noon here eat Supper Sister Ann Witmer come to Ann & Mary Polly was here all night

div3.head: June Wednesday 1 st
div3.p: this morning Isaac took them women down to Stouffers we washed to day Uncle was at the Mountain to fetch Shingles it rained

div3.head: Thursday 2 nd
div3.p: Isaac & I and the Girls was up at Bakers the Potters Ben & Herriet was along we got Some dishes very plesent

div3.head: Friday 3 rd
div3.p: To day the Carpenters come to put the Roof on our Barn it is plesent cool at night

div3.head: Satturday 4 th
div3.p: To day the Carpenters finished our Barn Uncle & I was in Town weather favourable

div3.head: Sunday 5 th
div3.p: To day plesent we was in at Saml

div3.head: Monday 6 th
div3.p: To day it Rained we was out in Feetville at Gockleys Polly went along to Snyders

div3.head: Tuesday 7 th
div3.p: it is plesent to day nice groing weather we planted our cabage

div3.head: Wednesday 8 th
div3.p: To day Rebeca and I was up at Isaac Barrs it Rained

div3.head: Thursday 9 th
div3.p: plesent weather Cool

div3.head: Friday 10 th
div3.p: To day it is plesent we baked and Churned

div3.head: Satturday 11 th
div3.p: Uncle was in Town and at John Mellingers I worked in the garden Chrislly Bare come here this evening the girls & I was at Bens

div3.head: Sunday 12 th
div3.p: we have been down at the pike in meeting Bro Martin Hoover Preached the Sermon it is plesent

div3.head: Monday 13 th
div3.p: it is Cool and plesent Becca George was here

div3.head: Tuesday 14 th
div3.p: To day we had Started to go down to Stoughstown and Christ Mellinger and his wife & two Children & Bil Mellingers wife and we had to come home we had been at Shippensburg they come to our place first

div3.head: Wednesday 15 th
div3.p: this afternoon Christs went over to John Mellingers Sisters Matty Burgard & Barbara Lantz was here eat Supper warm

div3.head: Thursday 16 th
div3.p: To day Uncle & Bec & I was in Towns we made a little hay they hauld it home after Supper very good hay weather warm we got new dreses

div3.head: Friday 17 th
div3.p: To day it is very warm Isaac Wingard went to help his Father to Mow Uncle is plowing our Sugar Cane we got new dresses

div3.head: Satturday 18 th
div3.p: To day it is very warm not quite as warm as it was yesterday I have a Spell of headache Jane Snider was out

div3.head: Sunday 19 th
div3.p: I had a Restless Sabeth my head Still ached Browns was here and a great many more Bill Schoffield & more

div3.head: Monday 20 th
div3.p: To Day it plesent we was picking Cherrys and made hay Isaac was mowing

div3.head: Tuesday 21 st
div3.p: To day we had mowers grass is very heavy Uncle took Cherries to Town he got 10 cts a quart it is a little cloudy

div3.head: Wendnesday 22 nd
div3.p: it is plesent and Cool this evening the men hauld hay after Supper the Girls helpt to to make hay we was picking Cherries

div3.head: Thursday 23 rd
div3.p: To day they hauld hay home very good hay weather it thunderd this Evening not Raind much it is getting dry Liza Bogs & her two girls was here eat Supper

div3.head: Friday 24 th
div3.p: it is very warm to day the girls and I was in Town we hauld Some hay in we got muslin 50 cts a yard Some 40 cts a yard

div3.head: Satturday 25 th
div3.p: To day we mowed our last grass four mowed it is very warm and dry things looks witherd up Rain would be good but Lord thy will be done

div3.head: Sunday 26th
div3.p: we was all in Meeting to day it is very warm it Thunderd it Rained a few drops Henry Wingard come home with us Ed Weston & John Lorrance & Bee Weston

div3.head: Monday 27th
div3.p: it is cool this Evening a little cloudy they hauld hay. Flockman got a load

div3.head: Tuesday 28th
div3.p: To day Bolly and Liza Burk eat dinner very dry cool this Evening Threatens a little for Rean this Eve

div3.head: Wendnesday 29
div3.p: no rain it is still cool the men took Some up to day we made all our hay without Rain it is three weeks Since we had Rain

div3.head: Thursday 30th
div3.p: Today we had a nice Shower of Rain we Commenced to cut Wheat plesent cool

div3.head:
Friday the
first day of July 1864
div3.p: Today it is warm it did not rain much they dont Harvest to day they are plowing corn we washed and our mulch Crocks out

div3.head: Satturday th 2nd
div3.p: Today it rained a little the sun is very hot and dry Mel went to Stoughstown after a Horse

div3.head: Sunday 3rd
div3.p: this Evening it is pretty much of an excitement it is rumoured the Rebs is coming Mel come home this evening in A hurry it is not quite so warm

div3.head: Monday 4th of July
div3.p: last night our men went of with our horses it was quite an Excitement about the Rebs coming it was A false Report perhaps they come yet wether is dry and warm

div3.head: Tuesday 5th
div3.p: To day Isaac come home with our horses we hauld some Wheat home the sun is warm and dry

div3.head: Wednesday 6th
div3.p: this evening the news come that the Rebs was coming we had loaded our Wagon with Corn and hay last evening and had a mind to lieve but they dident start this evening the news come that our Pickets was driven to Greencasel

div3.head: Thursday 7th
div3.p: To day it is warm and dry. we are working at our wheat Alexander Reeder come here on acount of the Rebels he lives in Hancock

div3.head: Friday 8th
div3.p: it is very dry and warm corn vegatables looks very rinkly and withery it is a litle cloudy this evening

div3.head: Sutturday 9th
div3.p: To day the men come home with our horses we finished our Wheat Harvest

div3.head: Sunday 10th
div3.p: To day it was warm this Evening it rained a good Showr it helps the corn and the cabage & vegables
it was Meeting at the pike

div3.head: Monday 11th
div3.p: this forenoon Houptman and Isaac Cratted our Barly this afternoon they hauld Wheat in for Houptman Mellinger Raked for Houp

div3.head: Tuesday 12th
div3.p: the men hauld the last of our Wheat in the Rakeing is out yet it is a little cloudy

div3.head: Wednesday 13th
div3.p: we finished our rakeings Isaac aint so well they hauld for Houptmans after supper that is Rye they are done hauling to

div3.head: Thursday 14th
div3.p: Today we was in Town Uncle and Isaac Raked up some barley and hauld home in the barn Polly and Beca was up

div3.head: Friday 15th
div3.p: To day Isaac mowed some timothy grass they put & load on the wagon for to take to Town it is very dry cool at night

div3.head: Satturday 16th
div3.p: Uncle & Isaac today they took a load of hay to Town for Twelve dollars a Ton this Evening they went a fishing they cetched thirteen fish they hauld two load of hay in the Barn

div3.head: Sunday 17th
div3.p: To day Uncle and I was in at Brother Saml Mary Stoner was out to day eat dinner

div3.head: Monday 18th
div3.p: To day uncle & I was up at Mattys warm and dry the men hauld the last of our Barley in

div3.head: Tuesday 19th
div3.p: To day it is warm and dry Isaac was crateling oats Uncle was in at Shop Herriet was up and Polly
Anna Mellinger

div3.head: Wednesday 20th
div3.p: this evening it Raining it is a thunder gust it rained much it is raining yet Isaac is got done withour oats Rebeca aint so well

div3.head: Thursday 21st
div3.p: This Evening we had thunder gust it Rainid a Shour
Uncle was fishing

div3.head: Friday 22nd
div3.p: To day it is very Smokoy the Sun dount Shine right Isaac is plouging for Ben Fickes we washed beaked and churned

div3.head: Satturday 3 23rd
div3.p: it is cool this evening Rabeca aint well thies copel days I dount feel so well this Evening I have headache Ann is at Bens keeping house they went for wortelberys

div3.head: Sunday 24th
div3.p: To day there was Meeting in the Meeting house Bro Jacob Lehmon & Bro Henry Stricler & Cate Nellen come home with Uncle & Ann. I and Becca was not well

div3.head: Monday 25th
div3.p:
last it commenced Raining and Rained to day till this afternoon good rain
Cate Mellinger & Martha Cope come to see us Sal & Christ Mellingr braught then over

div3.head: Tuesday 26th
div3.p: Today the men was lukeing up Oats hauld it in the barn it is cloudy this Evenig my head is giling bette

div3.head: Wednesday 27
div3.p: to day Uncle took Cate Mellinger and Martha Cope to Town Edward Grove and his wife was out for Butter and Chickens we finished our Oats

div3.head: Thursday 28th
div3.p: To day we was up at Mattys Rebecca aint so well it is getting dry

div3.head: Friday 29th
div3.p: This Evening our men Slartld with our hourses the Rebs is coming again great trouble but we have to be giveing up and submit

div3.head: Satturday 30th
div3.p: O disdresing times here now Chambersburg is burnd to ashes Over two hundred houses burnd O Lord Strengthen thy children in whatever may befall them and submit to thy will

div3.head: Sunday 31st
div3.p: To day it is all quiet no Rebs about here now they went up towards Loudon Christ Mellinge and Cope come up tho see about the Rebs our men is down there John Houp come along up to see

div3.head: Monday nd the first day of August 1864
div3.p: to day it is more quiet we are looking for our horses to come home Bro Myers come here this evening he has his horses down at Middlesex he started down this Morning it Rained a littel

div3.head: A Tuesday 2nd
div3.p: they come home with our horsees great trouble it Rained a very little Saml Bro and Phillip Bear was here to day Uncle was at the pike and in at the spring for news

div3.head: Wednesday 3rd
div3.p: our men is hauling Manure out it is cool this evening and cloudy it rained a little it is dry we baked and washed behold the Lord is my Salvation and my Strenght

div3.head: Thursday 4th
div3.p: To day the girls and us was in Town to see the Ruins of Town it looks distressing People is bad of

div3.head: Friday 5th
div3.p: O trouble John Houptman & Isaac left with our horsees our men was houlling dung out we dont know whats before us we must put our trust and confidence in the Lord he is Lord of lords and King of kings he has all Power in Heaven and on earth he has promised to be with his Children in all triels and temtations

div3.head: Satturday 6th
div3.p: news is a little more favourable it is Reported that the Rebs is falling back this morning it Rained a little it is very dry

div3.head: Sunday 7th
div3.p: To day there was Meeting down at the pike School house old Sister Ryder was giving over to our Mother Earth She has labourd for that Rest which is in Store for all the Children of God our men come home to day

div3.head: Monday 8th
div3.p: our men is at haulling dong again Slow geting along with farmers Some of the farmers is coming home to day with there horses

div3.head: Tuesday 9th
div3.p: Our men is ploughing to day it is most to dry to plough the Sun is very hot we baked Liza Burk & Polly was up

div3.head: Wednesday 10th
div3.p: to day Herriet and her Children was up our men is ploughing and Shreding dung

div3.head: Thursday 11th
div3.p: this it is Raining a little Jo Mellinger come to day it is very warm and dry corn looks very withery and dry like every thing else gardens is not much

div3.head: Friday 12th
div3.p: it is very warm and dry Isaac is ploughing it is to dry to plough it ditent Rain much we churned

div3.head: Satturday 13th
div3.p: we baked Gery was here to day he is in the Army

div3.head: Sunday 14th
div3.p: Hellen H and Mary S and Sarah Sam Bell Stoufh eat there Dinner it is very dry and warm Edward W was up and Ben F

div3.head: Monday 15th
div3.p: I was up at Houptmans it is cloudy but no rain we can Read about Clouds without Rain our men got done ploughing in one field it is to dry to plough

div3.head: Tuesday 16th
div3.p: it is Raining some this Evening Manuel Millers Come heree here this evening Isaac is harrowing

div3.head: Wednesday 17th
div3.p: it Rainied a little we Raised our potatos they are Small this Season

div3.head: Thursday 18th
div3.p: we washed to day it is Cloudy it is very dry Isaac is rooling clods Uncle is mowing buers

div3.head: Friday 19th
div3.p: to day Mary and Sarah Chofield was here eat dinner Isaac commenced ploughing another field it is hard and dry il is cloudy
Uncle fetched some chop for the hogs

div3.head: Satturday 20 th
div3.p: to day it raining a little Uncle was in Town he baught a watermelon for 35 cts it much cloudy drisling weather

div3.head: Sunday 21st
div3.p: we was in Preasheing in the Meeting house Jacob Sehman and Saml Steine Preached George and Cerne Gress was here last night

div3.head: Monday 22nd
div3.p: to day Sister Hockman and Sister Ann Stouffer and Amilia Stouffer was here we had a good Shower of rain they eat dinner here

div3.head: Tuesday 23rd
div3.p: to day Martha and Anna Stoner was here eat Supper the weather is pleasent Isaac was harrowing Uncle fixed the thashing machine

div3.head: Wednesday 24th
div3.p: to day Polly and I was up at Houptmans it is geting dry Ann has a sore face

div3.head: Thursday 245
div3.p: Isaac helpt Houptman to thrash Uncle ploughed Rebeca and I went to Shulls for feef

div3.head: Friday 26th
div3.p: it is a little cloudy our men fixed the Mecherine to thrach it is Reported that Rebs is coming a cross or make attempt to do

div3.head: Satturday 27
div3.p: we was thrashing oats last night it rained some

div3.head: Sunday 28th
div3.p: to day we had lots of Strangers Samuel Wolf and yong Martin and David Stoner & Sarah Mellinger & George Wonders & Brother Jackson all eat Dinner John Houptman was here

div3.head: Monday 29th
div3.p: to day Christian Ekhart and her little girl was here eat Dinner & Supper it is cool and plesent the news is a little better
Anna Mellinger

div3.head: Tuesday 30th
div3.p: it is cool this Evening we baked Isaac is ploughing Uncle was mowing and burning briers

div3.head: Wednesday 31st
div3.p: Uncle was in the pints fishing he cautght Same I was up at Houptmans for some vele

div3.head: 1864 September 1st Thursday
div3.p: we washed this forenoon this afternoon we was up at Marthas Isaac finished ploughing up on the hill

div3.head: Friday 2nd
div3.p: I was at Browns and Burks Casey Houptman was along the men made Cider

div3.head: Satturday 3rd
div3.p: this forenoon we boiled Apple Butter and baked and Churned John and William Raifsnider is goings to be here all night

div3.head: Sunday 4th
div3.p: we went to the pike School house to Meeting Brother Lehmon was here and Raifsniders we all went to Meeting after Dinner

div3.head: Monday 5th
div3.p: last night it rained muth it is raining now Uncle fetched some Seed wheat from John Mellingers I am spining thread Maen Gott das herz ich breng ich der

div3.head: Tuesday 6th
div3.p: it was rainey and cloudy all day not much going on John Fickes and Adam Miller was here M lives in Adams Co and F in York Co

div3.head: Wednesday 7th
div3.p: to day we got a dispatch from our Brother Diedred Family that he is very ill then Mellins and I went down
Bro Saml went down to

div3.head: Thursday 8th
div3.p: it was plesent our Brother had great pains

div3.head: Friday 9th
div3.p: this morning at four O Clock our Dear Brother departted this troubllsome world to Rest of all his labour where will be no Sorrow and no temptations

div3.head: Satturday 10th
div3.p: last night it Rained verry heavy

div3.head: Sunday 11th
div3.p: to day our Brother was Buriyed he had a large funaral

div3.head: Monday 12th
div3.p: we come home to day

div3.head: Tuesday 13th
div3.p: to day Sarah and Mary Mellinger come here

div3.head: Wednesday 14th
div3.p: to day it rained till noon afternoon theyn went to the Papermill

div3.head: Thursday 15th
div3.p: I took them to town

div3.head: Friday 16th
div3.p: today the men made Cider Bec helpd Ben

div3.head: Satturday 17
div3.p: to day our men Sowed one field we boiled Apple Butter

div3.head: Sunday 18
div3.p: we was all in Meeting in the meeting House Mellinger and I went home with Marthas

div3.head: Monday 19
div3.p: the men is working at the Seeding our Butter Merchant come here this Evening to stay all night it Rained a little last night

div3.head: Tuesday 20th
div3.p: we baked and churnd Rebeca is making a Shird for Joe Miller the weather is plesent I was in Town I got some flawnd for a shirt

div3.head: Wednesday 21st
div3.p: I was in Town: the men finished another field they sowed with wheat the weather is favourable in good order to sow it is cloudy this Evening Ruhama Metz was here eat supper

div3.head: Thursday 22nd
div3.p: we was washing to day Uncle was ploughing for Hockman Isaac was helping Marshel I was at Houptmans this Evening today

div3.head: Friday 23rd
div3.p: Rebeca honed we Cut of Corn Abe Hocknan helpt it is very cloudy this Evening Zuer gabe und gescheng
Isaac fetched the flour of Six bushels of wheat

div3.head: Satturday 24th
div3.p: To day it rained we was Cutting of corn we baked the first time of our white flour

div3.head: Sunday 25th
div3.p: this Evening it is cool we was at Butlers Anna was in at Saml Rebeca was at home by her self Julie Walk was here

div3.head: Monday 26th
div3.p: to day we finished cutting of corn this we pared Apples and cut them to dry Uncle Sowed Reye in the corn ground

div3.head: Tuesday 27th
div3.p: Today the men finished Sowing the corn field Isaac and the girls was out for Walnuts we was pairing Apples for to dry

div3.head: Wednesday 28
div3.p: This morm we went down to Stoughstown it rained this forenoon

div3.head: Thursday 29
div3.p: To day we come home it is raining a little this evening the children was picking Apples Isaac was haulling Stones

div3.head: Friday 30
div3.p: Today we was thresing our Barly it is warm groing weather it is cloudy this Evening gib mir mein kind dein heiz cprichd du

div3.head:
October the first 1864
Satturday 1st
div3.p: the girls was in Town I bake bread and Ryes we churned the men was making road it rained this afternoon

div3.head: Sunday 2nd
div3.p: we was down at the pike Meeting Saml Sto preached this forenoon it rained Ben Kiler come here this Evening and Edward Weston was here Uncle went up to Houptmans Ann and I was down at Polly Wester

div3.head: Monday 3rd
div3.p: theg men was making Cider up at Marthas our Butter Merchant come here this Evening to Stay all night it rained a little this evening we was out at Whites Factary Harriet was along

div3.head: Tuesday 4th
div3.p: to Day we boiled Apple Butter twiced: I worked at the Vinegar. the men and Anna cleaned up Barley Polly and Harriet: Beca and Edward was up this Evening

div3.head: Wednesday 5th
div3.p: to Day Uncle and I was in Town the girls and I cleaned the Kitchen White washed it: it is misting this Evening very dark and cloudy Das ist mir lieb und wort du findist anders doch nich im hemmd und auf erue

div3.head: Thursday 6th
div3.p: it is very warm for this time of the Season Melly and I was up at Martha and Saml it Rained a little to Day

div3.head: Friday 7th
div3.p: to day Sister and Brother Swartly was here ove dinner we was up at Houptmans and at Lidigs it rained a little this Evening Cloudy

div3.head: Satturday 8th
div3.p: this morning we went to Waynsboro to Meeting the Communion was there we went to Henry Frinks all night to day the Emamination was

div3.head: Sunday 9th
div3.p: to Day the communion was we went to Jacob Frantzs after Preaching it was very cold it froze ice
we eat dinner at John Frantz

div3.head: Monday 10th
div3.p: to day we come home but we was at Abraham Frantzs we stopt in Waynesboro at George Fricks this evening we come home it is not quite So cold we eat dinner at Frantzs mistake turn back

div3.head: Tuesday 11th
div3.p: we cleaned house this forenoon this afternoon Ann and I was in Town we churned the men worked at the sugar cane

div3.head: Wednesday 12th
div3.p: we was washing it was raining. Isaac was up in Greencastle we made some higdorn I bround coffee Uncle was fishing in the pines

div3.head: Thursday 13th
div3.p: we was thrashing: this evening we was Ironing

div3.head: Friday 14th
div3.p: we baked and churnd and butcherd a small ghog we made pudings and a few sausage the men worked at the cane

div3.head: Satturday 15th
div3.p: we had our Examination to day we have quite a joyfull Evening George Frick and Wife Thorbs and Wife Jacob Frantz John Frantz Cate Nelon and three of Fricks children all night Over Dinner Jacob F. George Frick and wife & children

div3.head: Sunday 16th
div3.p: to day we had our communion Meeting Ryer was taking up to church by Babtism after Meeting Henry Funks was here eat & Dinner B. H. K.

div3.head: Monday 17th
div3.p: to day the men took our cane to the Sugar Mill we was up at Houptmans this evening The Butter man was all night

div3.head: Tuesday 18th
div3.p: Uncle sowed the cane patch Polly and Ann and I was to see the Molasas factory we stopt at Brother Saml and at Lorane we churned

div3.head: Wednesday 19th
div3.p: today we was in Town the men cleaned Wheat and took it to the Mill and braught our molasas we churnd the men is makeing ready to thrash

div3.head: Thursday 220th
div3.p: we was thrasing I and the girls helpt we baked a few loaves of bread and pies we put the beets in the Celler

div3.head: Friday 21st
div3.p: we was thrashing this afternoon I dont feel so well last night it rained it is geting a little dry

div3.head: Satturday 22nd
div3.p: it rained Uncle took our Bee and Bee Weston to John Snyders he was at the Factory I am well again
we made Souercrout

div3.head: Sunday 23d
div3.p: it is cold and llustery and cloudy yesterday it snowed at the Mountain

div3.head: Monday 24th
div3.p: it is dry Saml Stoner Ju was here this evening Uncle was in at Samls we was thrashing

div3.head: Tuesday 25
div3.p: we finished thrashing our Wheat it was misting a little it cant rain it is cloudy

div3.head: Wednesday 26
div3.p: our men was husking corn I was in at Byers Uncle was in Town we baked and churned

div3.head: Thursday 27
div3.p: to day we was over at John Mellingers this evening it is Raining we need rain our cistern is dry in the Ketchen

div3.head: Friday 28th
div3.p: it it was Raining to day our men couldn husk corn

div3.head: Satturday 29
div3.p: we churned it cleard of nice our men was husking corn Jessa Morningstar come to see us he lives in Canada he is going to stay all night

div3.head: ASunday 30th
div3.p: we went to Meeting down to the pike it is cloudy this Evening Jacob Lehmon Preached

div3.head: Monday 31st
div3.p: the the weather is plesent the men is husting corn we was washing

div3.head: Tuesday 31st2nd the 1st
div3.p: we ironed the weather plesent cloudy

div3.head: Novembr Wednesday the 1st 2od
div3.p: Rebca and I was in Town to Morow Morning if the Lord will and we live we will start to Clinton County

div3.head: 3 Thursday 2nd1st
div3.p: today Aunt and Uncle and Houptman and wife and Jacob Leahmon started to clinton County it is cloudy and rainy today I quilted my skirt today Beck helped me Ann is in school

div3.head: 4 Friday 2nd
div3.p: This morning it is still cloudy and raning Isac took Ann to school this afternoon it cleared off it is windy I made Anns new dress today Isac is choping wood

div3.head: 5 Satuerday 3rd
div3.p: today it is clear and colde we churned this morning Isac cleaned the stabels Mother was up we baked Molassses pies

div3.head: 6 sunday
div3.p: today is still colde Anne and Ida Fickes were here for dnner in the aftermon sarah stoner was here i was down at bens a little while

div3.head: 7 Monday 5
div3.p: today is cloudy and raining I was sewing today Isac was choping wood Ann was in School Mother and Beck was up

div3.head: 8 Tuesday 67th
div3.p: today it is coold and raining I quilted Aunts shirt today Becke helped me she stayed all night.

div3.head: 9 Wedensday 78
div3.p: this morning it is raining this afternoon it is very blustery isac and i was in town we took butter to town the roads are very mudy this morning wee churned butter.

div3.head: 10 Thursday 98
div3.p: today it is pleasant I baked Isac was hisking corn Harriet and her two little children were here for dinner

div3.head: 11 Friday
div3.p: today it is clear and cold Isac is husking corn I went out and helped him to shock some fodder wee are looking for Aunt and Uncle to come home this evening.

div3.head: 12 Satturday 11
div3.p:
this Evening we come home to our Respetive good home I felt very thankfull to God for his preservation and grace bestowed unto us
John Myers was here all night.

div3.head: Sunday 112 13
div3.p: we went to Meting this Morning there was Meeting in the Meeting House Amos Meller minister Preached and Sam Brother Saml. I got a knock in my Side in our journey going over a braker.

div3.head: Monday 124
div3.p: it is cold Washington Immel was here and Harriet & Polly Becca was at Hockmans to se Martha She got hurt by falling out of the Spring Wagon

div3.head: Tuesday 135
div3.p: it is sleeting very on plesent Becca is helping Bens to Butcher Uncle was going to plough but he had to stop

div3.head: Wednesday 146
div3.p: it is clear the men was husking corn we baked a little in the Stove Polly & Herriet was up we had a ladder pedler all night name Modes

div3.head: Thursday 167
div3.p: all dyay Cloudy and raining a little Uncle was fishing he catched a mess Rebeca and I was at the corner this after noon

div3.head: Friday 178
div3.p: it is quite whet it was rainig Uncle and Isaac went to the pike to Meeting the girls want to go too Uncle thought it was to dark Bec Weston was up Uncle was in Town

div3.head: Satturday 198
div3.p: no rain to day it was plesent we baked Uncle and Bro Saml went down to Landis there is Meeting there

div3.head: Sunday 2109th
div3.p: it is misting and raining all day I was up at Houptmans eat my Dinner there Uncle come home from Meeting

div3.head: Monday 21st
div3.p: it is raining since noon very wet weather rain most every day Uncle was ploughing this fore noon Isaac was cleanig the Stables Beca was kniling & I

div3.head: Tuesday 22nd
div3.p: we was up at Marthas Saml is sick Uncle staid up I com home my self Isaac was ploughing we took corn to mill for cakes

div3.head: Wednesday 23rd
div3.p: Uncle was up at Marthas Saml is a little better but not much we was wasing and Churned Reeder come here this evening to stay all night Polly and Heriet was here

div3.head: Thursday 24th
div3.p: we was up at Marthas Saml is very poorly Martha and Jacob Lehmon and Caty Snively they send a dispatch down to Lancaster this evening her and Caty come home Rebeca was in Town

div3.head: Friday 25th
div3.p: we have been up at Martha to see Saml he is very low as far as man can judge his time is soon run to an end he feels resigned and giving up his will to God

div3.head: Satturday 26
div3.p: last night Samuel Died at twelve O Clock Uncle was up when he died Releca was up to Ann and I Baked

div3.head: November Sunday 267
div3.p: to day Saml Stoner was giving over to our Mother Earth we was all up there was over 80 carragees

div3.head: Monday 278th
div3.p: Uncle & Beca was over at John Mellinger Sarah got Married last Thursday I have the headache our Butter Merchand come this evening to stay all night

div3.head: Tuesday 29
div3.p: to day Pap and Mother Hochanower was here and Ben Fickes K eat Supper here my head is better the men was hauling corn Fodder

div3.head: Wednesday 30th
div3.p: Ann and I was in Town She got a Slate and comb and coppy Book Rebeca is down at Bens Keeping house Herriet went away this afternoon Uncle helpt Stouffers to Raise a house it is warm

div3.head:
Thursday
December the 1st 1864
div3.p: December comes in in like a lamb it is vey plesent and warm the men is ploughing Uncle is working with Sash our horse he has lise Rebeca come home this evening

div3.head: Friday 2nd
div3.p: this evening Reeder & June come to stay all night Isaac Wingard time is up to day Uncle is ploughing this afternoon we killed a Small hog and Beef it is raining this evening

div3.head: Satturday 3rd
div3.p: to day Rebeca made tribe I Salted our Beef and pork the weather is wery warm it was raining little Uncle was ploughing

div3.head: Sunday 4th
div3.p: it is very plesent Uncle went in to Hockmans I was at Pollys the girls was at home Edward & Beca was up

div3.head: Monday 5th
div3.p: it is cloudy old Wine cup come this evening to stay all night Edward and Beca was up this evening Herriet was up eat dinner Uncle is ploughing

div3.head: Tuesday 6th
div3.p: this evening Brother Jacson come here this day we made white Pudings and Churnd and browed coffee Uncle was ploughing rained a little

div3.head: Wednesday 7th
div3.p: Uncle and I was in Town the weather is very plesent for the time of the Season Uncle Cut Westons hog up

div3.head: Thursday 8th
div3.p: the weather changed very Suden it is very cold and windy it froze Uncle was poughing he brought the plough home for this winter the girls was up at Houptmans this evening I was at Westons Edward has a sore face

div3.head: Friday 9th
div3.p: Uncle fetched the flour of 8 bushels of Wheat this afternoon he fetched a load of Coal this evening there was Meeting in the Meeting house Brother Hershey Preached H and his Daughter and Niece come home with us to stay al night

div3.head: Satturday 10
div3.p: last night a deep Snow fell it is not quite so cold more modarate Uncle took Hersheys up to Houptmans this afternoon he was in Town he got the Shouts fixed at the barn Edward was up eat dinner

div3.head: Sunday 11
div3.p: this forenoon we was in Preaching in the Meeting house this Evening we was down at the pike Meeting it is very cold this evening Ben Kiler is here this eve

div3.head: Monday 12
div3.p: it is very cold our Butter Marchant come to stay all night Jacob Leidig and Polly was here not much going on

div3.head: Tuesday 13th
div3.p: it aint quite so cold to day it snowed a little this morning Uncle took Wheat to J Stouffers Mill for John Mellinger I was at Bens

div3.head: Wednesday 14
div3.p: we was in Town Beca and I got new dreses Uncle got two under shirts weather quite moderate

div3.head: Thursday 15
div3.p: we was up at Marthas Polly was along it is Snowing this evening or rather raining it aint so cold to morow if the Lord will and live Saml and Caty and I want to go to Cumberland Co on a visit

div3.head: Friday 16
div3.p: today Aunt and Samuels Stoner went down to Cumberland Co Uncle took Aunt to town it is raining we all three got new dreses turn 56th page I made a mistake

div3.head:
December
Satturday 17th
div3.p: very plesent Uncle went to Fayettvill the girls was baking

div3.head: Sunday 18
div3.p: old Pap Lantz was here it Rained this afternoon

div3.head: Monday 19
div3.p: this forenoon it was Raining Uncle fetched the Paper and fished

div3.head: Tuesday 20
div3.p: plesent to day Herriet was up the girls Churned

div3.head: Wednesday 21
div3.p: to day it Snowed and is cold

div3.head: Thursday 22
div3.p: to day we come home from our visit we was with our Brothr Diedrichs Family and at Rucks & yong Dieters & at Steavens & at Abner Millers with old Sister Newcommer and with our only Sister Wolfs and with old Sister Bair I feel thankfull to the Lord for his preservation that we could come home to our Dear familys

div3.head: Friday 23
div3.p: it is very cold and windy Uncle was in at the Spring we baked bread & pies and cakes

div3.head: Satturday 24
div3.p:
to day it is more moderate we baked Sugar cakes Ben Kiler and Rebeca went down to Wanesboro Ann Fickes is here to slay all night John Fickes was here Ben Fickes brought his Pork up to Smoke
Anna Mellinger

div3.head:
December
Sunday 25
div3.p: to day there was preaching down in Stouffers Town B Saml Steiner and Br Jacob Lehman Preached B Saml & Caty and little Jacob was out & Brother Hockman & Br Lichtry & Br Criter from Lancaster Co Matty Burgart was here this Evening

div3.head: Monday 26
div3.p: to day Polly and I was at Burks it was Raining A little our Butter Merchant come here this Evening Uncle was in Town Rebeca come home to day

div3.head: Tuesday 27
div3.p: it aint So cold it moderaded Uncle and I was in Preaching at the pike Brother Christain Whitmer one of our Ministers preached Bro Martin Hoover and Bro Jacob Frantz was up here to

div3.head: Wednesday 28
div3.p: to day we Butcherd David Stoner helpt it is very Soft and mudy Snow is going fast it rained last night it is cloudy this evening

div3.head: Thursday 29
div3.p: This Evening we was all in Preaching in the Meeling house Brao Whitmer & Bro Samr Stoner Preached

div3.head: Friday 30 th
div3.p: to day Brothers Witmer and Haar come here eat Dinner then we went a long up to Marthas we had a plesent company Uncle and them went up to Houptmans Houptman took Harr and we took Witmer up to Maty

div3.head: Satturday 31 st
div3.p: last night it Snowed not So very cold it is windy this evening Uncle was down at Dan Stouffers he fell and hurt himself he eat Dinner at Brother Saml then they both went down to Dan and Jocob Stouffers they eat DinnerSupper at J Slouffers

div3.head: Sunday Jenuary 1 st
div3.p: New year in the year of our Lord 1865 to day it is very cold Houptmans John & Casy & Susan & three Children eat dinner this afternoon Herriet and Susan Watson and her children was up this evening the Girls & Edward Weston and Bee Weston was down at the pike in preaching

div3.head: Monday 2 nd
div3.p: to day we was down at Pap Lantzs over dinner we went to Town first we took Susan Watson to Town old Sam Diserd and Mike Ebersole was here this Evening Edward Weston fetched a bashel of corn

div3.head: Tuesday 3 rd
div3.p: it is not So very cold nice winter weather Rebecca was in Samls David Butler is here this Evening it is Snowing this evening Polly was up cuting a cap I was at Bens & at Pollys

div3.head: Wednesday 4 th
div3.p: it is Some colder, windy. Uncle trampt some Oats for the cows

div3.head: Thursday 5 th
div3.p: we sheld corn Uncle took corn & Oats to the Mill for the Cows chop pleasent weather for the Season not much going on now I knit Beca is sowing Jane is going to school.

div3.head: Friday 6 th
div3.p: to day it Rained most all day not much going on

div3.head: Satturday 7th
div3.p: it snowed most all day we baked bread & pies Liza Burks Bee Weston & Polly was here over Dinner Ben Fickes was up he come home from York Conty.

div3.head: Sunday 8
div3.p: it was very cold this mornig Uncle & I was in Meeting in the Meeting house Ben Kiler come here from Meeting Brother Saml and Jacob Lehmon Preached.

div3.head: Monday 9
div3.p: the weather is changable not So very cold Uncle was in at Saml

div3.head: Tuesday 10
div3.p: last night it Rained fast it is quite icy to day Matty and Jacob Lehmon and Caty Snively and her Son was to See us eat Dinner with us Chris Mellinger was here this evening he brought news that Sally Mellinger is Sick

div3.head: Wednesday 11
div3.p: to day it is Jey yet and cold Uncle got our Carrag fixed

div3.head: Thursday 12
div3.p: to day we was down at Bill Mellingers Sally is better it is thawing the Sun was warm to day

div3.head: Friday 13
div3.p: we baked bread & pies Polly and Herriet was up Uncle helpt Ben to haul his Wheat up in our barn to thrash

div3.head: Satturday 14 th
div3.p: we had a cople of Snowstorms it is cold and windy Uncle cleaned the Stables it ditent thaw any to day Polly brought her pork up to smoke

div3.head: Sunday 15 th
div3.p: not so cold to day John Mellingers Youngsters was over to day Edd Weston & Bee was up Mellingrs eat dinner

div3.head: Monday 16
div3.p: to day it is very cold and windy Uncle was in at the Spring I was at Bens it Snowed a little last night Bolder here was

div3.head: Tuesday 17
div3.p: it snowed a little to day pretty cold Manuel & Jacob Thomas come here this Evening we helpt Ben Fickes to thrash

div3.head: Wednesday 18 th
div3.p: it is cold Jocob Thomas left here this morning for Carlisle Manuel is going to Stay awhile Uncle helpt Ben to clean his Wheat

div3.head: Thursday 19 th
div3.p: it is cold Uncle & Manuel went into the spring to the Mill we Churned

div3.head: Friday 20 st
div3.p: last night it snowed still cold Uncle & Manuel went to Town We went to Jacob Leidigs

div3.head: Satturday 21st
div3.p: Manuel come home this evening Mary Stoner and yongg Brother Hershey & Leha & Maria Hershey & Caty Frantz & her son John

div3.head: Sunday 22 nd
div3.p: it is more moderate yesterday it Snowed & rained and Sleate we was all in down at the pike Meeting this forenoon we and the Sisters and Bro Hershey went to Christ Stouffers over Dinner we had happy times

div3.head: Monday 23
div3.p: our Butter merchant was here all night to day it quite moderate this forenoon it rained this afternoon it snowed Uncle left this morning Tuesday 24 on the early train to go to Lancaster County to see our Dear Brothers & Sisters Peace go with them Brothers Saml & Jacob Lehmon is going too this evening Edward & Bee Weston was up Manuel & our girls and them was Singing I feel lonesome for Uncle

div3.head: Wednesday 25
div3.p: very cold to day we churnd Emanuel & Ben was at Butlers we washed a little

div3.head: Thursday 26 th
div3.p: Emanuel and Beca & I was up at Marthas and at Saml it is still cold dont thaw any

div3.head: Friday 27
div3.p: today Our Emanuel left us we feel very lonesome this evening the girls and I are by ourselves Uncle aint come home yet no change in the weather it is very cold

div3.head: Satturday 28
div3.p: weather not much changed we think it is not quite so cold Polly & Bee was up the evenings is long for us no person but the girls & I

div3.head: Sunday 29
div3.p: to day Jacob Leidigs come here then I went along to Hockmans Susa Lantz and Casey was down Ben Kiler was here a while the weather is a little changed not quite so cold Herriet was up

div3.head: Monday 30 th
div3.p: it was thawing a little to day and the Sun was shineing very bright Herriet & I was in at Saml Ben took us in the Slaigh Beca kept her Children

div3.head: Tuesday 31 st
div3.p: it is quite moderate it was thawing Mary Stoner & think in Mary Keiser come to day She come with David Stoner he was down we was washing & Bakeing.

div3.head:
Wednesday
Febuary the first 1865
div3.p: not so very cold it is plesent Mary Stoner & I was down at Joseph Riders Mary Saml Mary was out with Rebeca

div3.head: Thursday 2 nd
div3.p: to day I took Mary Stoner up to Marthas Maria Pennwille came here to Stay allnight it is Still cold at nights in day time it is not so very cold Herriet & Liza Bucks was up

div3.head: Friday 3 rd
div3.p: it Snowed to Day this Evening it is raining Ben & Polly was up I was at Bens a little we was looking for Uncle

div3.head: Satturday 4 th
div3.p: Uncle come home Beca & I was in town for him it is plesent it was melting the sun was warm

div3.head: Sunday 5 th
div3.p:
we was in Meeting down in the Meeting house; this Evening in preaching down at the pike it is most wonderfull cold and windy Cate Nellen was here over Dinner Ben Kiler is here this Evening
Byers wife was takeing up in the church

div3.head: Monday 6 th
div3.p: Uncle bought three Sheep on Flecks Sales it aint quite So cold it is thawing a little the Butter Merchant was here

div3.head: Tuesday 7 th
div3.p: to day it is snowing all day it is very deep it is Snowing yet we Butcherd Ben Fickes & Ben Kiler helpt to B Brother Lantz was here eat dinner from Indian State

div3.head: Wednesday 8
div3.p: to day Mary Stoner come here again we took her up to Houptmans Susan Lantz was here the wind is cold

div3.head: Thursday 9 th
div3.p: Mary Stoner & Uncle & I was up at Mattys it is still cold it is very long cold Winter

div3.head: Friday 10 th
div3.p: to day we took Mary to Town She took the Evening train to go home we took Butter to our folks it is cold

div3.head: Satturday 11 th
div3.p: it is quite plesent Uncle fetched 13 hundred of Coal we baked mince pies Herriet was up

div3.head: Sunday 12 th
div3.p: last night it commenced Snowing and snowed till about nine O clock this morning it is very cold Jacob Leidigs was here eat Dinner Ben Tucker was up Beca was at Pollys

div3.head: Monday 13 th
div3.p: last night was a very cold night as cold as any night this Winter Uncle was up at Marthas they killed a Beef Beca was down at Bens

div3.head: Tuesday 14 th
div3.p: last night was the coldest night for this winter I think So anyhow Uncle was at Shelters Sale him and Hockman Hall was up

div3.head: Wednesday 15 th
div3.p: to day it snowed & sleet and Sometimes rain the snow is deep Uncle & Bro Saml down at the pike I was up at Houptmans

div3.head: Thursday 16 th
div3.p: to day it is moderateing the Snow was melting Some we was in Town this forenoon this afternoon Uncle was fishing he catched 3 fish waight 1 lb and a half

div3.head: Friday 17 th
div3.p: it is raining this Evening it is quite moderate we had a Brotherly Meeting to day in our Meeting house Uncle fetched chop for our cows a barl of flour for Polly

div3.head: Satturday 18th
div3.p: it is cloudy this Evening last night it snowed Sister Fanny Hatherington is here to Stay all night we are very glad for her compeny Uncle went to Lehmons with Bro. Saml there is preaching there

div3.head: Sunday 19th
div3.p: to day Fanny Hatherington and I was down at the Pike Preaching Uncle and Saml come home this Evening Susan and Edward Weston and Snyders girls and Mowers was here weather mild

div3.head: Monday 20 th
div3.p: Uncle was at Boots Sale Beca and I was at Pollys the weather changed it is thawing the snow is melting

div3.head: Tuesday 231 rdt
div3.p: to day Leha Stoner come many Keesere sister from Cumb Co here we went down to Reafsniders fliting us and Leha Rebeca went down this forenoon to Lidigs

div3.head: Wednesday 224 thnd
div3.p: it rained a little it is moderate L and B and I was down at Pollys this afternoo Casey Houptmans and Barbara Lantz was here eat Dinner David and Mary Stoner was out this evening Laha went with them

div3.head: Thursday 23 rd
div3.p: the Snow is melting fast Uncle was fishing he caught 8 fish waighing 4 lbs 1 oz we was quilting I made candles 4 moulds full

div3.head: Friday 24
div3.p: we was in Town I got muslin for 37 cts a yard calico 25 cts a yards & coffee & sugar & towls Uncle got fishing hooks and lines

div3.head: Satturday 25 th
div3.p: it is very disagreable it is raining all afternoon it is freezing ice on the trees not so warm as it was

div3.head: Sunday 26th
div3.p: it was plesent but it is very wet and Slopy the Snow is melting fast we was all at home it was a long Sabbeth no peson here Uncle & Ann was at Bens

div3.head: Monday 27
div3.p: it is very cloudy this Evening it is moderate Leha & Anna Stoner come here Bec & Edward Weston are here this Evening Herriet was up we washed

div3.head: Tuesday 28 th
div3.p: this Evening we all was in Preaching in the Meeting house Bro Riest and Bro Welpmer Preachers R from New York State W from Dauptin Co. Rebeca Leah & Ann went on the Spring wagon Leah was driven Bro Riest & Bro Jacob Frantz was here all night Cate Nelen was here over Supper

div3.head:
Wednesday
March the first 1865
div3.p: Uncle & I was at the pike Meeting this Evening Bro Riest & Bro Welptmer Preached it is cloudy it aint so cold it is windy Letch Stoner left to day

div3.head: Thursday 2 nd
div3.p: it was raining to day Uncle and I was at Bro Jacob Stouffers this afternoon we went to Daniel Stouffers them that is Seeking come together to open there experience they all feel Strong in the Lord Bro Riest and Saml & Jacob Lehmon was there we churnd

div3.head: Friday 3 rd
div3.p: last night it rained Some this forenoon Uncle was fishing he caught 9 large Suckers Polly was up for Butter

div3.head: Sutterday 4
div3.p: it is colder to day very windy Uncle took Wheat to the mill for bread While he was in Town he braught chop from Stouffers mill for our cows

div3.head: Sunday 5 th
div3.p: Uncle and I & Ann was in Preaching in the Meeting house George and Sarah Wonders come home with us from Preaching John Houptman was here

div3.head: Monday 6 th
div3.p: Uncle was fishing he caugt 4 fish it is plesent little soft our Butter Merchant is here all night Rebeca was in at Saml

div3.head: Tuesday 7 th
div3.p: To day we was up at Mattys and a Brothers Saml the weather is plesent but it is getting very mudy H was up

div3.head: Wednesday 8 th
div3.p: to day Liza Burks & I was at Brother John Metzs it is cloudy Uncle was fishing he caught 5 nice fish Herriet was with her children

div3.head: Thursday 9 th
div3.p: it is very plesent Uncle was fishing he caught 2 large Suckers I was up at Houptmans

div3.head: Friday 10 th
div3.p: it is more cold and windy to day Uncle braught the flour home to day 11 1/2 Bushels of white wheat we churnd

div3.head: Satturday 11th
div3.p: Uncle was in Town paying our tax it amountet to 51 Dol 44 cts this is for bunnty money it is very cold

div3.head: Sunday 12 th
div3.p: to day Uncle and I was at home our selves and Liza and Becca Dolly and Mary and Burks and Polly Daniel Resh is here this Evening Anna was at Raifsnider Bec at Stouffers

div3.head: Monday 13 th
div3.p: to day Sally Mellinger was buried Uncle and Rebeca was down at her funaral the weathe plesent

div3.head: Tuesday 14th
div3.p: to day it is very plesent Sister Byer and her two children was here over Dinner Liza Burks and Herriet was up we baked we was planting peas

div3.head: Wednesday 15 th
div3.p: it rained all day Uncle was fishing he caught 6 fish they waight 4 lb we churnd Butter it dont rain this Evening but it is cloudy

div3.head: Thursday 16 th
div3.p:
to day John Metz moved Uncle and Beca helpt them to move it is windy all day a great storm this Evening and rain Ann and I was up at Houptmans a while
Anna Mellinger

div3.head: Friday 17 th
div3.p: Polly & I was in Town I took Butter in we got well Aproves I got Coffee and Sugar it is very windy yet last night it took Roofts off of Some buildings it is not very cold it is clear star light

div3.head: Satturday 18
div3.p: it was still windy To day it is drying of they were Drafting in our Township Guilfort

div3.head: Sunday 19
div3.p: to day we was down at the pike Preaching Brother and Sister Hershey come home with us they stayd all night with us weather is very plesent we made garden and planted our Onions and Swoed Salled

div3.head: Monday 20
div3.p: them three uper rows belongs to this day our Butter man is here to night plesent weather it is warm we have no fire this Evening

div3.head: Tuesday 21
div3.p: Susan Lantz & I was over at Huslars Ban Kiler come to day Uncle fetched him it is warm and plesent it is Raining this Evening & the wind is blowing very strong we bakd bread and pies

div3.head: Wednesday 22
div3.p: it is very Stormy and Cold we was thrashing oats This forenoon it got to windy they had to quit Polly & Beca was up & Herriet

div3.head: Thursday 23
div3.p: the wind is very high it is all day Stormy old Boldes is here all night Ben was Herring till it rained it is cold this evening

div3.head: Friday 24
div3.p: it was plesent to day it was a little windy our men was working at the oats ground Jinny Obanon & Emma Stouffer was here all night

div3.head: Satturday 25
div3.p: it is pretty cold Uncle & I & Beca was in Town Beca got a tooth drawn and Uncle got 17 pulled out it was Snowing a litlle

div3.head: Sunday 26
div3.p: it is cold and rough Polly & I was down at Henry Ryders Eddy & Bec Weston & Casy Raifsnyder all eat dinner here.

div3.head: Monday 27
div3.p: Uncle & I went Sister Susan Brown then Uncle went to Newcommers sale he bought a lounge the girls washed: Ben sowed the Oats it is plesent

div3.head: Tuesday 28
