div3.p: it is plesent and dry the roads are very dry and dusty Polly and I was in at Brother Samls Ben was ploughing the Potatos Patch this forenoon they hauld manure Uncle was fishing he catched 8 fish waighing 4 lb & up

div3.head: Wednesday 29
div3.p:
to day is plesent and warm we need no fire this Evening we planted some Potatos Ben was Ploughing for Hockman the girl fixed a room for Mary Cosgrove I baked bread & pies and churnd Polly & Herriet & Bek was up
Anna Mellinger

div3.head: Thursday 30 th
div3.p: it commenced raining last night and rained till noon it is raining this Evening again I was up at Houptmans fetching a Stand that I bought from Casy Uncle was fishing he catch 4 fish Ben was makeing a fishnet Beca was up at Houptmans help them to prepare for the Sale

div3.head: Friday 31 st
div3.p: to day Houptmans sale was we was all up it was rainig and misting all day very mudy Brother Kochanouer is here the night

div3.head:
Satturday
April the first 1865
div3.p: it is cold and windy this Evening this fore noon we helpt Houptmans to moove this afternoon we fetched Mary Cosgrove we churned

div3.head: Sunday 2 nd
div3.p: we was in Preaching in the Meeting house Brother Martin Hoover Preached & Brother Jacob Lehmon Kochanouer Brother was here all night Sarah Stoner was here over dinner John Myers' & Rachel his wife was here Herriet & Ben was up plesent weather

div3.head: Monday 3 rd
div3.p: it is warm and plesent it is cloudy this evening Uncle was fishing he catched one large Sucker for Mary Ben was Ploughing for the Willow Grove folks our Butter man is here the night

div3.head: Tuesday 4 th
div3.p: it commenced raining last night and rained till noon then the sun come out but not long this Evening it is raining again the men cant do much Uncle was in Town

div3.head: Thursday 5 th Wednesday
div3.p: Ben was greasing our gears and Harness Uncle was fishing he catched 3 nice Suckers it is plesent and warm all day Cloudy

div3.head: Thursday 6
div3.p: to day Lehmons was Mooveing we was up to help them Ben was picking Stones, it rained this forenoon warm rain we baked

div3.head: Friday 7
div3.p: Rebeca & I was at the Factory for yearn for Mary it is cool this Evening Ben finished the Paper Mill folks lots made them reddy for to plant Potatos we churnd Polly & Liz was up

div3.head: Satturday 8
div3.p: it is cool to day Uncle was fishing he caught 4 fish Uncle took Butter to Town Ben was ploughing for Ben Fickes

div3.head: Sunday 9
div3.p: it is raining a little this Evening Cathy Stoner & Jacob was here eat Dinner we went down to Polly it is cool

div3.head: Monday 10
div3.p: it is raining nearly all day Uncle was up to see Lehmon he is sick we baked cakes & pies

div3.head: Tuesday 11
div3.p: it Rained Some this afternoon Ben was ploughing for Ben Fickes I was firing the Peach trees put hen Manure to the roots Uncle at the blacksmith shop fetching a plough

div3.head: Wednesday 12
div3.p: we was in Town Uncle & I he got a new pair of pants & west Matty & Anna & Leha Lehmon was here eat supper it is cloudy & rainy all day much rain

div3.head: Thursday 13
div3.p: we was thrashing the rest of our Oats weather plesent Widder was here all night we baked & Churnd & brown Coffee & Brand

div3.head: Friday 14
div3.p: the girls was washing I done the work I made pickels Uncle was down at Stouffers after planter Ben was ploughing plesent weather little windy

div3.head: Satturday 15
div3.p: it was raining all afternoon much rain Ben was ploughing for corn for us this this afternoon they was Cleaning Oats up we churned I plant early cabbage

div3.head: Sunday 16
div3.p: it is cold this Evening Mary Stoner was here Uncle & I was down at the pike peaching Bro Jacob Lehmon & Bro Saml Stoner Preachd

div3.head: Monday 17
div3.p: it is plesent Uncle was fishing he caught 9 Suckers Our Butter man is here the night Liza Cosgrove was here to day eat dinner I made soup

div3.head: Tuesday 18
div3.p: it is plesent and warm it rained a little we was diging garden Ben is ploughing up at Lehmons we dont need no fire this Evening

div3.head: Wednesday 19 th
div3.p: Bro Daniel Slouffer & Wife was here to day plesent weather growing Liza Burks & Polly was here eat Supper

div3.head:
Friday
Thursday 20
div3.p: it is Raining this Evening it is cool we planted our potatos and made some garden I was down at Raifsniders Uncle fetched lime to White wash it rained and thunderd very hard we churnd

div3.head:
Friday 21 st
Thursday
div3.p: we baked weather changable Ben is ploughing for at Lehmons

div3.head: SaturDay 22 nd
div3.p: to day we co Slacked lime to white wash Ben got done ploughing at Lehmons he was ploughing at Ben Fickes

div3.head: Sunday 23 rd
div3.p: Liza Burks & I was over to see May McDole Amilia & Saml Stouffer & Hellen Hutherington was here it is very cold to day it snowed some

div3.head: Monday 24
div3.p: it was a hard frost last night it was plesent to day I plant some beans & cucumbers the men are making Ready to plant corn

div3.head: Tuesday 25
div3.p: very plesent growing weather we washed the men was herrowing the Corn ground

div3.head: Wednesday 26
div3.p: Pege Raifsnider & her Mother was here Over dinner we cleaned our Kichen and white washsed I plantted Some Sweet corn

div3.head: Thursday 27
div3.p: I was in Town to day the girls got new dreses our people was planting Corn at Lehmons the Sun was very warm

div3.head: Friday 28
div3.p: this Evening Cousen David Stoner and wife & two Daughters come here it is plesent the men is prepareing our corn ground it rained

div3.head: Saturday 29
div3.p: old Bro & Sister Obenlende was here we was down in the Meeting house there was Brotherly Meeting and to examine the Seeking ones Liza Franz Betze Hofman & Lize Shangler came here to day al night

div3.head: Sunday 30
div3.p: there was preaching in the meeting house Bro Jacob Frantz & Bro Jacob Lehmon preached Sam Diseed come home with us

div3.head: May the first 1865Tuesday 2 nd Monday
div3.p: Polly and I was over at Overcashs it was a frost last night it is cold

div3.head: Wednesday 3 rd Tuesday 2 nd
div3.p: it is still cool no frost this morning I plantit beans Ponpkins & cucumbers cabage & tomattos plants Da Frantz & Wife & Jacob Lehmon & Mary Wednesday 3 rd Stoner was here over Supper

div3.head: Thursday 4
div3.p: we was plantting our corn it was cool it is cloudy this evening I worked at the vineger

div3.head: Monday the first day of May
div3.p: the men are preparing the corn ground we was sowing I made a mistake

div3.head:
Saturday
Friday 5
div3.p: Uncle & I was in Town Ben hauld Stone it rained and thunderd it is plesent & warm Mary Stoner of Saml Beca was up I plantted some cabage

div3.head: Saturday 6
div3.p: it is plesent and warm Liza Burk & Mrs Stobs was here over Supper

div3.head: Sunday 7
div3.p: Lehmon & wife was here over supper & Sarah Null was here over Dinner George Hoover & A Mary was here this afternoon

div3.head: Monday 8
div3.p: it rained the girls cleaned the upstairs it is cool not much going on

div3.head: Tuesday 9
div3.p: to day Uncle and I was up at Marthas Uncle helpt to clip the Sheep it rained part of the day

div3.head: Wednesday 10
div3.p: Bro Saml and Caty and Mellinger and I Liza Mary Stouffer & Fany Hatherington & Mary Polly all was up at Isaac Bains cleaning there house it was Raining & misting all day

div3.head: Thursday 11
div3.p: it is still raining very whet and mudy the men commenced makeing stone fence

div3.head:
Saturday
Friday 12th
div3.p: we was in Town it is cool and we must have fire in the Stove it is plesent no rain to day we churned

div3.head: Saturday 13
div3.p: we baked Polly & I was at Shulls it is cool at night

div3.head: Sunday 14
div3.p: we was at the pike Meetting Bro Jacob Lehmon Preached it is plesent

div3.head: Monday 15
div3.p: we washed we was over at John Mellingers we called at Danl' Stouffers for sweet potato plants we got 200 plants plesent and warm our Butter man is here

div3.head: Tuesday 16
div3.p: we plantted our Sweetpotatos plants this Evening we white washed our room and cleaned the other rooms

div3.head: Thursday and Wednesday 18 17
div3.p: Sister Mary Stoner and I was visiting at the pike to day we went to Stricklers from there Eversols & Byers then to old Metzs in the evening we went to Houptmans all night in the morning we went Jacob Stouffers over Dinner then Ben come for us we got Strangers Susan Goely & her Brother come to see us Mary come home with us after supper Uncle took her home

div3.head: Friday 19
div3.p: we baked and churnd Uncle was fishing he caught 4 fish Ben Fickes is white washing the Barn Ben is makeing Stone fence

div3.head: Saturday 20
div3.p: we was in Town we got a quarter barle of Mackerals for 5 Dol & 5 cts we took peach butter in we got 20 cts a quart it rained and Thunderd this evening

div3.head: Sunday 21
div3.p: to day we was in Adam County Brother Saml & us Melling & I there was preachig in Mumacksburg it rained Thunderd very heavy it washed much waters are very high

div3.head: Monday 22
div3.p: we come home to day very watere along the road John Wolf come home with us

div3.head: Tuesday 23
div3.p: Bro Saml & Bro Koll? come here I have the headache I got it yesterday the weather is plesent it is cool to day

div3.head: Wednesday 24
div3.p: Polly & Liza Burks & I was at Stobs on a visit it is cool the men is fixing our corn it is washed out with the heavy rain we Churnd

div3.head: Thursday 25
div3.p: I was howing our cabage & planted some beans John Wolf come here to day he was up at Mattys the Sun was warm

div3.head: Friday 26
div3.p: it is cool it rained some this forenoon it is cloudy this evening we baked & churned the is working at the corn Uncle & Beca was in Town

div3.head: Saturday 27
div3.p: to day we had our examanation Bro Saml Hershey preacher and Landis & wife Mary Polly Bro Ginerich & Bolly & Caty and Mary Reeder was here all night it is plesent little cool

div3.head: Sunday 28
div3.p: we had our Communion there were 6 persons takeing in the Church Bro Jacob Frantz Gross Moosa preache Kiser Sister Hershey all ove Dinner it is raining a little this Evening it was very plesent to day

div3.head: Monday 29
div3.p: Polly & Caty is here this Evening we was up at Lehmunz Matty brought them down it is cool this Evening and all day

div3.head: Tuesday 30
div3.p: Polly & Caty left to day we went with them to Samuels then Uncle took them to Town it was cool this evening

div3.head: Wednesday 31st
div3.p: I plented our cabbage to day old Kiler & Mary was here over Dinner the Sun was warm

div3.head: June the first Thursday 1st
div3.p: I planted beets we churned 13 lb of Butter Uncle was cleaning wheat Ben was ploughing Corn old Pappy Lehmon was down

div3.head: Friday 2 Wednesday 2 nd
div3.p: we was in Town Uncle got a new coat for 8 Doller Anna got a parrasull for 2 Dollers

div3.head: Saturday 3 rd
div3.p: to day Uncle went to Waynsboro to the Communion Meeting Ben was haulling Manure & mills & Stones Polly and I was up at Lehmons I got some Strawberys we will presarve them Bec & Edward was up Ben Fickes was up

div3.head: Sunday 4 th
div3.p: to day we had a good many Straingers Uncle did not come home Joe Ryders eat Supper and Sarah Stoner Westons Family was up it is warm

div3.head: Monday 5th
div3.p: it is very warm it Thunderd this evening but no rain it is cloudy I was in to Mary Jones she is poorly Cate and Mary Mellinger was here

div3.head: Tuesday 6 th
div3.p: its cool today all day cloudy Susa Lantz was here eat Dinner & Supper her & me was up at Lehmons Jane Snyder was out I was planting cabage

div3.head: Wednesday 7
div3.p: it is dry it is cloudy these cople days but no rain not so very warm we churnd Ben was working at the corn Uncle made a Shovel plough Ann & Herriet was picking cherrys

div3.head: Thursday 8
div3.p: no rain yet it thunderd but no rain we had Straingers Mary Stoner Bro S & S Stoner and Meno Hershey & wife & Sister and two of Christ Hersheys children all eat Supper Ben was picking Cherrys about a Bushel

div3.head: Friday 9
div3.p: Uncle and I was in Town we took 42 quarts of cherries in we got 121/2 cts a quart we took Anna to the cart She went to Shippensburg her & Mage Mellinger

div3.head: Saturday 10
div3.p: it rained a good Shower it is cloudy this Evening we baked we worked in the garden we got Mutton from Marshal Leha Lehmon was here

div3.head: Sunday 11
div3.p: Peter & John Melingers boys was here & Liza & Leha Brihs eat Dinner Snyders yongsters was here & George Henderson it is plesent cool

div3.head: Monday 12
div3.p: Herriet was up oever dinner & ch-l- we was picking cherries we picked 14 Bushels for sale about 1 Bushel for our own use it is a little cloudy the Sun was warm our Butter man is here to night

div3.head: Tuesday 13
div3.p: it is very warm & dry it is cloudy Leah Stouffer & Hetty Ryder & Anna Hoover Sister of Hettys eat Dinner here we was picking cherries

div3.head: Wednesday 14
div3.p: it is raining this Evening Anna & I was in Town she got a pair of Shoes for 3 Dollars Mary got 2 linnan Sacks I got Sugar

div3.head: Thursday 15
div3.p: it is cloudy all day it was raining a little it is cool the men finished the corn up at Lahmons we was howing our cabage

div3.head: Friday 16
div3.p: we washed and the men fixed for mowing it is dry and warm we baked & churned

div3.head: Saturday 17
div3.p: we was mowing it was mowing grass is very heavy it is down very much it is very warm

div3.head: Sunday 18
div3.p: Sus West was Married it rained a little Shower it is very warm we was in Preaching this afternoon over in Meferrans Schoolhouse Bro Saml Preached Cate Nellen went along Pappa Lantz was here over dinner & Cate

div3.head: Monday 19
div3.p: we had a nice rain this afternoon we was mowing to day they some hay home the ground is Soaked pretty well

div3.head: Tuesday 20 th
div3.p: it was raining a little nearly all day no hay weather Polly & I was in to see Mary Jones she is sick she is a little Better we was at Hockermans

div3.head: Wednesday 21 st
div3.p: no rain to day they hauld two loads of hay in it is spoild pretty much we churned

div3.head: Thursday 22 nd
div3.p: it is plesent they hauled 5 load of hay in they did not moy any to day we baked

div3.head: Friday 23 rd
div3.p: to day we hauled the last hay in that was Cut we have some to cut yet the weather is very Faverable to make hay

div3.head: Saturday 24
div3.p: we finished our hay to day it thunderd but no rain it is getting dry Liza Cosgrove come out to day

div3.head: Sunday 25
div3.p: There was Preaching in the Meeting house Bro Saml & Bro Jacob Lehmon Preached John Houptman & Lize Priun and Liza cosgrove was here over Dinner Liza Lehmeer two Miller women was here

div3.head: Monday 26
div3.p: it rained this forenoon and Some this afternoon a good rain Hockman was out this Evening

div3.head: Tuesday 27
div3.p: to day we hauld our last hay home we commenced cutting Wheat we baked

div3.head: Wednesday 28
div3.p: it is plesent not so warm they are working at our wheat the girls washing Mamma Lehmon was here

div3.head: Thursday 29
div3.p: our men hauled Some wheat in they are cutting to day it is plesent a good breze Sister Mary Polly was here over Supper

div3.head: Friday 30
div3.p: it is raining this Evening we are Still Harvesting it is warm

div3.head:
Saturday
July the first 1 st
div3.p: it was raining this Evening I was in Town Beck Weston was a long Liza Burks and Polly was here I got jars

div3.head: Sunday 2 nd
div3.p: it is very plesent and cool Mellinger & Polly and I was up at Mattys Liza & Beca Burks & Ruhama Metz & Matty Burker was here and Mary Stoner eat Dinner

div3.head: Monday 3 rd
div3.p: it is plesent they are cuttig our Rye Henry Hockman is helping to Cratte Liza Burk & I was out helping

div3.head: Tuesday 4 th
div3.p: to day we got done Harvesting very warm it lightend this Evening but no rain the day of independence

div3.head: Wednesday 5
div3.p: we are haulling Wheat in the barn it rained Some this morning this after noon they hauled in they hauld 3 loads this forenoon

div3.head: Thursday 6
div3.p: it rained Some last night they still hauld grain in Polly & I was at Burks we baked cakes

div3.head: Friday 7
div3.p: we got done haulling grain they had to Stack the Rye they made two Stacks it is warm & day

div3.head: Saturday 8
div3.p: it rained a little Shower it is getting dry and warm the men hauled the Barley in and some Rakings in Uncle & I was in Town it is raining this Evening

div3.head: Sunday 9
div3.p: we was down at the pike preaching Saml Stoner and Jacob Lehmon preached it is cloudy this Evening

div3.head: Monday 10
div3.p: it Commenced raining at two Oclock & is raining yet a good rain the earth was dry the men hauled the last Wheat rakeing home we have some Rye rakeings out Liz Snider was here for currants Mat Lawrence & Bek Weston was up for Apple Butter

div3.head: Tuesday 11
div3.p: we was thrashing Wheat rakeings the girls helpt I was cook it is cool this Evening Edward Weston eat Dinner here

div3.head: Wednesday 12
div3.p: Uncle took our thrashing Machene to Town to get it fixed Ben -udt oats it is plesent

div3.head: Thursday 13
div3.p: Uncle took Potatos to Town for two Dollers a Bushel it is cool this Evening we washed

div3.head: Friday 14
div3.p: we baked & Churned Uncle fetched our thraching Machene we got it repaired Liza Lehmon was here over Supper it is cool at night

div3.head: Saturday 15
div3.p: Uncle & I was in Town it is very cool at nights it is cloudy this Evening

div3.head: Sunday 16
div3.p: we had a nice Soaking rain it commenced this afternoon and is raining this Evening it was tolerable dry corn looks well Sister Mary Polly & her Sister was here over Dinner

div3.head: Monday 17
div3.p: no rain to day it is cool and plesent Ben commenced ploughing to day the ground is soaked pretty well we paid our tax 18 Dollers

div3.head: Tuesday 18
div3.p: it is cloudy this Evening we thrashed Some oats it is plesent

div3.head: Wednesday 19
div3.p: we put the rest of our oats up Matty & Nancy Strickler was here over Dinner and Supper

div3.head: Thursday 20
div3.p: to day the Girls & Ben & I was out in the Mountain for Wortelberys we got 18 quarts Anna & I dident pick any we staid with the Wagon Some places they are plenty

div3.head: Friday 21
div3.p: we was in Town I got six Jars to put up fruit it is very warm Ben was ploughing it is Cloudy

div3.head: Saturday 22
div3.p: it rained a copple Showers it is plesent Ben was ploughing he broke the Doble tree Polly & Liza Burk was here

div3.head: Sunday 23
div3.p: there was Meeting in the Meeting house Anna & I was at home Lise Stewart & Sarah Lehmon was was here over Supper Isaac Wingart and Christ Mellingers come here from Preaching they eat Dinner Edward Weston & John Lawrance and Hall was here

div3.head: Monday 24
div3.p: it is cloudy Uncle was working Wheelba Ben finished one field ploughing

div3.head: Tuesday 25
div3.p: it rained a good Shower Ben commenced haulling Dung

div3.head: Wednesday 26
div3.p: yesterday went up to the Ryder folks we was first at Adams we was alright at Mikes

div3.head: Thursday 27
div3.p: to day we was at Bens over Dinner we come home to day Billy Weston come home it rained this forenoon

div3.head: Friday 28
div3.p: it rained a good Shower it is very warm and close we was in Town after Supper I got Coffee

div3.head: Saturday 3029
div3.p: it is warm we baked we got six bushels of Wheat ground for bread

div3.head: Sunday 30
div3.p: Brother Saml & Caty and Jacob was out & Moli Burk was here over Dinner the sun is warm

div3.head: Monday 31
div3.p: Cassy Houptman and Barbara & Ann Lantz was here over Dinner & Supper John Houptman come for Mellinger Sarah has the wildfire he is goig to Stay all night it is cloudy

div3.head: Tuesday 1st
div3.p: the first Day of August to day Caty Girl was here eat Dinner Mary Stoner & Alice was here our men fixed the Barn yard: it is Cloudy I think it will rain

div3.head: Wednesday 2
div3.p: it was raining some to day Liza Burks & May McDole & her children was here Eat Supper it is very warm

div3.head: Thursday 3
div3.p: it rained a good Shower Ben was hauling Dung for Ben Fickes not quite so warm

div3.head: Friday 4
div3.p: Uncle was in Town with Apples 4 Bushels one peck 80 cts a Bushel the sun is warm we baked & churned it is raining this Evening thunder

div3.head: Saturday 5
div3.p: it is very warm to day most to warm to plought Bro Martin Hoover & Son was here over Dinner Lotts come this afternoon with there children She is our Niece they live in Adams County

div3.head: Sunday 6
div3.p: Lotts & us went down to pike Preaching Brother Martin H Preached and Bro Saml Lotts & us went up to Mattys we went alone we eat Supper there Byers two Girls eat Dinner here

div3.head: Monday 7
div3.p: Anna & I was at Burks it rained this morning right smart old Pap Shank eat Dinner with us it is Cool this Evening

div3.head: Tuesday 8
div3.p: the Girls washed I baked Maria Hasler & children was here over Dinner & Supper it is Cloudy this Evening our men hauld Stone on the Road

div3.head: Wednesday 9
div3.p: it it plesent Ben is ploughing it is cool

div3.head: Thursday 10
div3.p: we are dryng Corn it raind a little Ben cut a Walnut tree down for fire wood

div3.head: Friday 11
div3.p: we finisheed driing corn it is cool and plesent we dried Some beens

div3.head: Saturday 12
div3.p: to day I want to go down to my Sister Fanny Wolf and Family

Rebecca wrote down when I was away
it is cloudy Aunt & Mary Stoner went to Cumberland Co Uncle took them to Town we baked

div3.head: Sunday 13
div3.p: it is clear & warm Polly was up Eddy eat Dinner here him & Ben rode the Colts Uncle went to Preaching this afternoon

div3.head:
Saturday
Sunday Monday 14
div3.p: this morning it is cool and cloudy we churnde the men finished ploughing at home after Supper they commenced to plough at Ben Fickes

div3.head: Monday Tuesday 15
div3.p: to day I come home from my Visit I found them all well Uncle come into Town to bring me home

div3.head: Tuesday Wednesday 16
div3.p: it is raining this Evening the ground is getting dry Ben is ploughing for Fickes Uncle is makeing a gate post Polly was up Pap Lehmon was down

div3.head: Wednesday Thursday 17
div3.p: it is raining this Evenning Ben is ploughing it was plesent not so warm

div3.head: Thursday Friday 18
div3.p: it was raining a little this morning Matty & Cassy Ryder come here this after noon eat Supper Casy is here all night Ben finished ploughing for Fickes

div3.head:
Saturday 19
Friday
div3.p: I took Casa Ryder down to Hoovers I went to Town

div3.head: Saturday 20
div3.p: Polly & Liza Lehmon & I was at Overcashes there yongest child got Buried Uncle & Hockman was fishing Uncle brought 14 fish home they finished Thrashing at Fickises

div3.head: Sunday 21
div3.p: we had Preaching in the Meeting house Brother Saml preached Mary & Anna Stouffer and Jacob Ebersole & Wife & Cate Nelen was here over Dinner

div3.head: Monday 22
div3.p: it is Thumdering and raining this Evening we commenced thrashing Wheat our Butter Merchant is here all night

div3.head: Tuesday 23
div3.p: we thrashed 28 Doz & 10 Sheves it made 22 bushels it is raining since noon a good rain Maria Hasler was here for crab Apples

div3.head: Wednesday 24
div3.p: Liza Burk and I went over to Flecks for Cucumbers it is very cool Ben is Harrowing Uncle was in Town on a Govenment Sale

div3.head: Thursday 25
div3.p: I got 29 yards of calaco the gurls was washing I was in Town this forenoon Maria Stouffer and Polly Eby was here over Supper it is still cool most a frost Ann got a pair of Shoes for 2.50

div3.head: Friday 26
div3.p: it is not quite so cool this Evening we got 123/4 of Mutten from Marshal the gurls was Ironing Beca was up at John Lehmons for Mary Ticing for a fether Bed

div3.head: Saturday 27
div3.p: Rebeca and I was in Town we got Shoes misured I got flannel for Shirts for Uncle and Aprons & Bonnets for the Girls it is plesent

div3.head: Sunday 28
div3.p: Hockmans was here and some little bays over Dinner it is very warm and Sultry this Evening

div3.head: Monday 29
div3.p: we was thrashing the Sun was very warm it is cloudy this Evening

div3.head: Tuesday 30
div3.p: we was thrashing we thrashed yesterday 35 Doz it made 31 bushels Frank Hockman & Jacob Lehmon helpl Jr: it was very warm

div3.head:
the first Day of September 1865 it is a mistake
Wednesday 31
div3.p: we finished thrashing for now they are Cleaning the Wheat to Day it is warm and dry

div3.head: Thursday
div3.p: we cleaned 65 Bushels of Wheat it was 63 Doz we washed it was warm to day as it was any time

div3.head: Friday 1 Sept 1st
div3.p: the first Day of September they hauld our Wheat to the Mill it was 68 Bushels Emely Daily & her girl was here over Supper Herriet was up it rained a good Shower it thundered we are puting up Peaches and Tomatos and are drying Peaches

div3.head: Saturday 2
div3.p: it rained nearly all day a little we baked it is very warm and sultry

div3.head: Sunday 3
div3.p: Bro Jacob Lehmon & Mary Stoner & John Houptman and Emly Daily & her and Bens Children all over dinner we went to the peke preaching

div3.head: Monday 4
div3.p: we was pearing peaches and we put some up in Jars the men commenced Sowing Wheat Rebeca & Polly went over to Fastville to Snyders

div3.head: Tuesday 5
div3.p: the men finished one field Sowing Ann & I are very busy drying Peaches and made Spice pickels and other Pickels

div3.head: Wednesday 6
div3.p: to day Christ Mellingers and two of there Children come to See us we raised some of our Potatos there are fine I was was working at the Peaches

div3.head: Thursday 7
div3.p: Beca and Ben made Cider to day Christs went over to Johns Uncle went with them to Town on the Goverment Sale he Bought a pair of Harness for 14 Dollers it is raining this Evening

div3.head: Friday 8
div3.p: it is raining this Evening we boild Apple Butter Susan Watson come here this forenoon Uncle brought brand for our pigs & cows

div3.head: Saturday 9
div3.p: it was raining a little nearly all day this forenoon a good Shower Matty Snively come with us from Town She was here over Dinner we have Meeting in the Meeting house

div3.head: Sunday 10
div3.p: we had not many Strangers to day Hockman & Leha Lehmon & Mary Shull was here not eat here it is all day Cloudy not quite So warm Uncle was not well he had a bowel complaint

p.del:
Sunday 28
Hockmans was here eat Dinner & some little boys eat here it is warm this Evening

div3.head: Monday 11
div3.p: it got nice and clear to day but it is still warm we was down at Westons Billy Beck moved away from Polly Bill went away we dont know wether hel ever come back we raised the remainder of our Potatos they are pretty good Beck Burk fetched our letter cettel to boil Apple Butter

div3.head: Tuesday 12
div3.p: we commenced Cutting of Corn Stobs two boys helpt Rebeca and I was at Burks helping to boil Apple Butter it was cloudy but very warm

div3.head: Wednesday 13
div3.p: we made Cider it is Cloudy and very warm for this time of Season on we paired Apples and Tomatos

div3.head: Thursday 14
div3.p: we boiled Apple Butter and boiled Cider of to drink we baked it rained heavy Shower & is cloudy yet Liza Cosgrove come here to day Harriet & Bec Burk & Bolly & Ladh Lehmos was here

div3.head: Friday 15
div3.p: we was to old Sister Gochanouer She is Sick we was up at John Stouffers Dan is poorly the girls washing we churnd the Butter is very soft it is Clear this Evening not quite so warm Isaac Shetters Saturdaywas here fixing pigs Liza Cosgrove left to day Bro Hockman got us 40 Dollers from

div3.head: Saturday 16
div3.p: we was in Town weather is changed more cool Polly and I was at Burks seeing the sick Ben is thrashing Rye Uncle was husking a little corn

div3.head: Sunday 17
div3.p: to Day we had preaching in the Meeting house Lize Brimen & Bece Overcash was here over Dinner Bec Weston was here it is plesent and Clear & cool change in the weather

div3.head: Monday 18
div3.p: it is Cool weather is change very much we made Catsup our Butter Merchant is here all night

div3.head: Tuesday 19
div3.p: it is cool most cool Enough for frost the men Sowed the strips in the cornfield with rye Brother Hockman got one Hundred Dollers till Spring from Mellinger

div3.head: Wednesday 20
div3.p: we are Cutting of Corn it is not quite so cool I made Some more Catsup Sister Emma Snider come here this Evening Uncle fetched the flour from 6 Bushels of Wheat

div3.head: Thursday 21
div3.p: I took Emma Snider down to Stouffers it has got warm again the men is Cutting of Corn Beca Washed & Ann & I Baked and made Catsup

div3.head: Friday 22
div3.p: we got done cutting of corn we churned the girls was Ironed it is quite warm for this time of Season Uncle got a dip net from Brother Hockmam

div3.head: Saturday 23
div3.p: Beck Burk and I was in Town it is cloudy and more cool the men commenced Sowing the corn field

div3.head: Sunday 24
div3.p: we had Preaching here to day Brother Jacob Lehmon Preached it was warm to day Cloudy part of the day to day our Sister Fanny was takeing up in the Church as a Member

div3.head: Monday 25
div3.p: it rained Some the men was Shuffling Wheat ground we was pareing Apple to day it is Clear this Evening

div3.head: Tuesday 26
div3.p: it is cool this Evening and Clear the men Sowed another field with Wheat we baked Beca quilted a Skirt for Anna I put more peaches up we have a old Beggar here this evening

div3.head: Wednesday 27
div3.p: to day the men was finished Seeding all but the Cane pach and the Sweet Potato pach it was cool last night Uncle out of the Broomcorn it is very nice long Nancy Hoover was here eat dinner I put up Tomatos

div3.head: Thursday 28
div3.p: Ben and Anna was blading the Cane Uncle was husking a little corn I took Herriet ove to Shivelys She went to after a gin they took 30 Bushels of Wheat to the Mill I was at Lehmons See for Pork

div3.head: Saturday Friday 29 30
div3.p: it was raining this Evening it got a little dry we made Sour krout and Raised Some Sweet Potatos they are very large Some waight 21/2 lb Ben Fickes was here this evening

div3.head: Friday 29
div3.p: Ben & Beca & I was in Town they Bought a Cooking Stove and Churn and Some bottle things Uncle hauld the Cane to Mill

div3.head: Sunday the first day of October 1865
div3.p: Preaching Potatos and we it is cool enough for a frost Sister was here for Supper Meeting house Bro Saml Stoner Preached

div3.head: Monday 2
div3.p: to day we moved Sister Mary Cosgrove to Hockmans we put up Sweet Potatos a barle and a Stove Box full Ben is thrashing Rye Uncle Sowed the Cane patch Pap Lehmon was here

div3.head: Tuesday 3
div3.p: it is raining a little this Evening Uncle finished Sowing to day Ben was thrashing Rye the gurls and I was at the Potters fetching Crocks it is Cold we had no frost yet

div3.head: Wednesday 4
div3.p: it is raining this evening it did not rain much last night it is cold but no frost Uncle was husking corn Ben is thrashing Rye the girls washed

div3.head: Thursday 5
div3.p: to day word come that our Sister Polly Seiner Died Ben Kiler and Rebeca got Married we was up at Mattys She has the Miessles

div3.head: Friday 6
div3.p: to day Uncle and I went down to Pollys our Brother Diedrichs Family She died yesterday clear & warm

div3.head: Saturday 7
div3.p: to day our Sister Polly was entered over to our Mother Earth Bro Kiser & Bro Miller Preached her funeral Sermon

div3.head: Sunday 8
div3.p: we was in Preaching in Shepperdstown Kiser and Miller Preached we went to Tobias Millers over Dinner in the Evening we went to Diedrich Stoners all night

div3.head: Monday 9
div3.p: this forenoon we went to the girles over Dinner then Mary took us to Machanicsburg to the Cars then we went up to MiddleSex Bro Ginerichs & Bro Gross

div3.head: Tuesday 10
div3.p: to day we come home Bro Gross fetched us to the Station Ben come to Town for us this afternoon

div3.head: Wednesday 11
div3.p: I took Polly & Liza to Town Uncle fetched Coal one Tun he baught two Tun for Twenty Dollers it is very warm and dry the Wheat Seed can not come up I took Butter in

div3.head: Thursday 12
div3.p: it is cool this Evening we killed a litte beef Uncle was in Town to get his mouth measured the girls was washing

div3.head: Friday 13
div3.p: we had a frost last night it is a little cloudy the men was husking corn at Lehmons Polly and I was in at Hockmans to See Mary the gurls Schoured the tin things the men Sheld Corn

div3.head: Saturday 14
div3.p: we had our Examination to day Sister Fanny come to See us She is here to night Bro Moser was here over Supper Henry Funks was here eat Dinner & Sister Frick

div3.head: Sunday 15
div3.p: John Frantz & wife & Sone Henry Funk & wife & Daughter and Sister Shoemaker & Sister Shantel & Sister Frick all here for Dinner Sarah Mumak Kadilea Ginerich & Jacob Lehmons & wife is here this Evening to Stay al night

div3.head: Monday 16
div3.p: this morning Bro Saml and Caty braught Sister Faring out they was here over dinner I took Fanny to town She took the Cars to go home Sarah M & Ka Ginerich left this morning

div3.head: Tuesday 17
div3.p: we are husking corn our Corn is very good they husk at Lehmons I helpt a little it is plesent not so warm

div3.head: Wednesday 18
div3.p: it was raining all day and is raining yet a warm rain Uncle took 4 Pigs to Town 8 weeks old for 13 Dolles 3 dollers and a quarter a head

div3.head: Thursday 19
div3.p: to day Belica Moved down to Polly we was in Town got some Chairs and Bed Stead it is very cold and Blustery

div3.head: Friday 20
div3.p: it is still windy and cold our men is husking Corn Maria Hasler and Sister Louisa Frick was here I went with them to Pollys it rained a little last night

div3.head: Saturday 21
div3.p: it is plesent we hauld Corn home

div3.head: Sunday 22
div3.p: we was up at John Lehmons with old Pap and Mother Lehmons it is plesent it is frosty in the morning

div3.head: Monday 23
div3.p: Uncle and I was down at John Frantz to See about a Cow not much Change in the weather not cold clear

div3.head: Tuesday 24
div3.p: to day Uncle took Pet down to Frantz he is going to bring a Cow along we washed Beca helpt Ben was husking corn it is quite modeate it is cool

div3.head: Wednesday 25
div3.p: this afternoon Uncle brought the Cow home hard frosts at nights it is plesent through the day it is dry our Sisterns will Soon be dry if it dont rain

div3.head: Thursday 26
div3.p: it is still dry and moderate our men is done husking Corn up at Lehmons Herriet was up over dinner

div3.head: Friday 27
div3.p: Ann and I was in Town we took Butter in it is raining a little this Evening our men was hauling corn Fodder from Lehmons

div3.head: Saturday 28
div3.p: it rained last night it was a very good rain it was dry it is getting cold and blustery our men was fishing they caught 23 fish they was husking corn this afternoon

div3.head: Sunday 29
div3.p: to ther was meeting at the pike School house Sister Spangler come here from Preaching Uncle was down I have the cold it is windy and cold

div3.head: Monday 30
div3.p: I took Sister S up to Mattys it is plesent for the Season our men is husking corn it is Cloudy this Evening

div3.head: Tuesday 31
div3.p: it rained all forenoon our men was Sheling Corn 64 Bushels of ears it made 37 Bushels of sheled we Churned and made yeast

div3.head: Wednesday the first day of November 1865
div3.p: to day Peter Mellinger and Wife & 3 little girls come it was very fogty this morning & cool P & Saml was fishing

div3.head: Thursday 2
div3.p: Mellingers folks went away this morning it is raining and Cloudy all day not So Cold I have a Headache spell all week

div3.head: Friday 3
div3.p: it is very wet it is misting and raining all day Slow husking corn we baked & churned

div3.head: Saturday 4
div3.p: it was raining all day Uncle was in Town not much going on

div3.head: Sunday 5
div3.p: we have been at Houptmans they moved to there new home last week it snowd Some John Bear & wife & Daughter come here this Evening to Stay all night

div3.head: Monday 6
div3.p: Uncle & I took Bears down to Danl Stouffers we was there over Dinner then Uncle took them to the Cars it is cold & windy

div3.head: Tuesday 7
div3.p: it is pretty cold and clear this Evening we had a Merchant for our home the men are husking corn most to cold

div3.head: Wednesday 8
div3.p: we took Beca Burks to Town to the Dr Senceneys to get her townale Cut out we went to See a house that we have a mind to bye it is cold & windy

div3.head: Thursday 9
div3.p: to day them men was here to see about our place it is very plesent the men is still at our Corn we kiled a hog Beca was up to help Anna washed

div3.head: Friday 10
div3.p: it is warm for the Season we baked and Churnd Ben was hauling Corn the corn is very good

div3.head: Saturday 11
div3.p: we was in Town I got a new Shawl for Anna: it is cold this Evening and clear I got a new globe for the little lamp

div3.head: Sunday 12
div3.p: it was preaching in the Meeting house we went to Hockmans after preaching it is plesent a little cold

div3.head: Monday 13
div3.p: to day Abner Millers and children was here eat Dinner it is plesent Ben Burk com here to stay a while

div3.head: Tuesday 14
div3.p: Bro Strawbridge come here & Sister Liza Burks & Mamy Staubs eat Supper

div3.head: Wednesday 15
div3.p: we was thrashing Stobses helpt us it is remarkable nice weather we need no fire to day so warm Beca & Anna & I was at Ben Fickes this Evening

div3.head: Thursday 16
div3.p: we cleaned our Wheat Still warm it rained a little early this morning

div3.head: Friday 17
div3.p: Uncle and Shuk went to See Some Mountain land Ben Fices Bucherd I was down awhile

div3.head: Saturday 18
div3.p: Uncle and I was in Town Bro Strawbridge come here this Evening it is raining a little this evening

div3.head: Sunday 19
div3.p: Uncle took Bro Strawbridge down to Oarstown it is plesent

div3.head: Monday 20
div3.p: Uncle come home at noon we cleaned up Wheat it is very Cloudy

div3.head: Tuesday 21
div3.p: it was raining last night and most all day Uncle was at John Metzes John is sick Beca was up we churnd

div3.head: Wednesday 22
div3.p: it is still whet and rainy and cool Uncle was over at Mekeys Mill B Samuel & B Jacob Lehmon was here

div3.head: Thursday 23
div3.p: Beca and I was down at Joe Ryders it is Cloudy and raining a little

div3.head: Friday 24
div3.p: last night it snowed a little weather very changeable we was in Town Shirk was here Thursday night Meeting at the pike

div3.head: Saturday 25
div3.p: the weather favourable we baked

div3.head: Monday 26
div3.p: this Evening to day we was at Lanzs it is sharp air

div3.head: Tuesday 27
div3.p: this Evening we all was in Preaching in the Meeting house plesent them Brothers come here this evening

div3.head: Wednesday 28
div3.p: we butcherd two hogs Sister Liza Burk & Beca Kiler helpt it was very cloudy & Snowed a little Bushman was the butcher them Brothers come here this evening

div3.head: Thursday 29
div3.p: this Evening Bro Hist Minister and Bro Cassel & Bro Strawbridge went home the rest staid all night weather changeable not So very cold much cloudy we churned Uncle took them to See Some of the Members this evening we all was in Preaching at the pike

div3.head:
Friday 3the
first Day of December 1865
div3.p: we cleaned Corn up Susan Gockly and her Son was here over Dinner & Supper

div3.head: Saturday 2
div3.p: we was Town Uncle got two Flannal Shirts and a pair of pants Anna got a sack I got three cups and five Saucers

div3.head: Sunday 3
div3.p: this Evening it was Preaching at the pike School house Bro Hist preached the last time toeremorrow he is going to lieve us remarkable weathe for the Seasan So warm

div3.head: Monday 4
div3.p: Herriet got a Daughter it was born at four OClock PM most to warm Liza Burk and I was there

div3.head: Sunday 10
div3.p: we had Preaching in th Meeting house Bro Saml Preached Bro Jacob Lehmin went West to visit our Members through the West I hope he will be Blessed on his Journey and the Lord will preserve him to day we Raised our house
it was very cold cold yet Snowed last night Sunday we had lots of Stranges this evening we have two Straglers all night water is vey low our Well is most dry not very mutch in the Cisterns

div3.head: Monday 18
div3.p: not near as cold cloudy This evening

div3.head: Tuesday 19
div3.p: it commenced Snowing this afternoon is Snowing and raining this this evening Uncle was in Town for boards for our house we was here

div3.head: Wednesday 20th
div3.p: not as cold as it was more moderate this after noon it Snowed

div3.head: Thursday 21
div3.p: Bens Butcherd there hog we was all down for our dinner it was very cold and windy

div3.head: Friday 22
div3.p: Uncle was in Town for some boards for the new house it is to cold to work at it Bro Raifsnider is to do the Carpenter work

div3.head: Saturday 23
div3.p: to day we Sold our house in Town by Public Sale come to 2 000 Dollers no change in the weather very cold dont thaw

div3.head: Sunday 24
div3.p: it Snowed last night and to day all Ten OClock mixed with rain not as cold as it was Uncle was at the pike preaching

div3.head: Monday 25
div3.p: Christmas it is quite moderate the Sun was warm it melted a good deel Mary Peary was giving over to her Mother earth Uncle was down to see her Buried Polly and Liza was here

div3.head: Tuesday 26
div3.p: Weather very changeable this Evening we had meeting in the Meeting hous

div3.head: Thursday 28
div3.p: to day the New York Brothers and Sisters was here eight in Number Bro Saml & Martha braught them here Brother Shisler and his wife Staid here all night

div3.head: Friday 29
div3.p: to day we butcherd two hogs Liza Burk & Beca helpt and Fickes Christ Zuck and his wife and baby come to see us Uncle was in for the them Bill Mellinger were here Saturday it snowed plesent

div3.head:
Monday
January the first in the Year of our Lord one Thousand eight Hundred and Sixty Six
div3.p: January comes in like lamb it is plesent we was down at the pike in preaching this evening Bro Herr from New York State preached

div3.head: 2 Tuesday
div3.p: to day we was at Eberlys one of there Children was Buried Bro Herr and Bro Saml preached the funeral Sermon it is plesent for the Season

div3.head: Friday 4
div3.p: it was very cold to day and last night the eggs froze in the nests Uncle was in Faettville buying a old house for a citchen and a washhouse

div3.head: Saturday 5
div3.p: it is not near So cold to day Uncle was in Town for our Advertisement for our Sale Beca come home to day She was at Metzs a copla weeks it is clear

div3.head: Sunday 6
div3.p: it is meeting in the Meeting house it is cold Bro Saml Preached

div3.head: Monday 8
div3.p: it was most wonderful cold People Say it was the coldest day for Some time I was up at Mattys

div3.head: Tuesday 8
div3.p: not quite as cold to day

div3.head: Wednesday 9
div3.p: weather is change very much not near as cold Raifsniders is here working at our house

div3.head: Thursday 10
div3.p: this evening Barbara and Matty Lantz come here to Stay all night not so cold

div3.head: Friday 11
div3.p: to day Emma Zuck come here She got Married last Tuesday it rained this afternoon

div3.head: Saturday 12
div3.p: it is very plesent and warm but mudy Polly & I was at Burks

div3.head: Sunday 13
div3.p: Danl Stouffer & Jacob Lehmon and Liza & Cate Nelon was here

div3.head: Monday 14
div3.p: it commenced Snowing this afternoon and Snowed nearly all night it blowed up very cold

div3.head: Tuesday 15
div3.p: we cleaned up Rye it is to cold to hauled the old house

div3.head: Wednesday 16
div3.p: it was sharp this morning but Still they went out for the old house Isaac Stoner come here

div3.head: Thursday 17
div3.p: this evening Jacob Stoner and Mary & David Stoner come Isaac went with them it is not so cold

div3.head: Friday 18
div3.p: they are Still hauling at the old house very plesent & warm

div3.head: Saturday 19
div3.p: it got most wonderfull cold this afternoon the men hauled four loads of the old house they got very cold the weather change very sudden

div3.head: Sunday 20
div3.p: weather changed very much Uncle & Beca went to pike Preaching this evening we all went down to Meeting house to Preaching Bro Bowman Preached & Bro Lehmon very cold

div3.head: Monday 21
div3.p: not quite so cold our Butter Merchant is here the night John Mellingers was here to day

div3.head: Tuesday 22
div3.p: it Snowed nearly all day not so cold weather changeable

div3.head: Wednesday 23
div3.p: we prepared for the Sale Beca was up it is snowing to day

div3.head: Thursday 24
div3.p: Our Sale was to day it was plesent not cold the Snow is pretty deep Jinny Sold for 224 Dollars Dick 93 Dollars Toby 110 Dollers Cows Lady 50 Dollars Dorry 551/2 Dollars Redy 40 Dollars hogs one Sow 30 Dollars Second Sow 25 Dollars third 14 Dollars 2 Small Shoats 25 Dollars Corn one Doller 25 cts a barrel

div3.head: Friday 25
div3.p: we cleaned our house we had a dirty house plesent winter weather

div3.head: Saturday 26
div3.p: Ann & I was in Town weather plesent it thawed little

div3.head: Sunday 27
div3.p: Uncle and I was up at Lehmon over Dinner Beca was at the pike Anna was at Kilers

div3.head: February the 1st
div3.p: February come in very cold

div3.head: Sunday 43 th
div3.p: there was preaching in the Meeting house Uncle was sick him and me and Anna was at home Beca went to Preaching Susan Lantz Bro Kochanouer John Houplman Jr come from meeting Susan Watson Beca Polly Harriet was here it is very cold most the coldest day

div3.head: Monday 5
div3.p: to day Eberlys little girl died She Swallowed a button

div3.head: Monday 12
div3.p: to day Mattys Sale it rained all day very damp

div3.head: Wednesday 14
div3.p: John Stouffers Sale was to day rained all day and is raining yet very mudy Snow is going fast Beca & I quilted a black Skirt for me to day
Our Brother Johns wife Died on the third day of February in the year of our Lord 1866 and his Daughter Louisa

div3.head: March the 19
div3.p: we moved in our old Castel or Cabin it Snowed some
on Tuesday Shirks Moved it rained in the afternoon it rained before they come very disagreabel

div3.head: May the 28th
div3.p: we Moved in our new house O Lord preserve us that we can move in thy house made without hands this is my prayer for in this Earthly house or Tabbernicle is a great many temptations and triels and Short comings O Lord precerve us to the end of our pilgremage that we can lead a quiet and a upright life before the and all men and to Establish thy truth
